all reboot aliens have been added removed clockwork with eon tho an au for reboot omnitrix  also this a au were ben never used upgraded the omnitrix also after the master control glitch which was temporary the omnitrix can now use a second playlist called playlist 2 gives the omnitrix more dna pods that are in in entries also theres more dna pods but u can guys can add more to this lorebook too also no omni key and no omni kix or omni naut or season 3 recalbrated and no Omni-Enhanced Forms unless u guys wanna add them go head also anyone can remove gax feedback, shock rock, ghostfreak, feedback, and some of reboot aliens
lorebooks.description:
Season 1
The Omnitrix looks like a very big wristwatch, primarily black and grey in color, with a grey dial in the middle (like a watch face) which has a green hourglass shape. When Ben selects his aliens, it shows the alien's silhouette.

In Omni-Tricked: Part 3, Phil put on a blue device on the outer side of the Omnitrix. It was supposed to control the temporary malfunction on switching from alien to alien.
Only 10 DNA Pods are available in the Omnitrix's loading chamber.[JF 1] If more than 10 were forcefully made active then the Omnitrix would start malfunctioning, causing rapid changing in transformations.[5] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 5][DR 6]
The Omnitrix does not have enough room to contain the DNA samples of every sapient race in the universe.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix does not have the DNA from Bashmouth's Species[DR 8] or the DNA of Silent Tentacle Sentinels.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix is keyed to the user's DNA, so only close relatives can use the pods.[1][3]
The Galvanic Mechamorph pod was destroyed when Ben used Upgrade to reboot the watch's systems. A massive feedback loop ravaged the in-system matrix, destroying the Mechamorph DNA pod.[2]
The Chimera Sui Generis pod was destroyed when Vil "absorbed" Gax.[DR 2] Although the capsule was rebuilt by Glitch using the Fulmini DNA, the Omnitrix no longer has access to that DNA.[DR 3]
DNA pods
DNA pods concept art

Blank pods within the Omnitrix are able to read DNA, and create new pods.Ben was able to use parts of a destroyed Fulmini soldier to create a new DNA pod.
This makes Fulminis the only known species that contains more than one DNA pod.
The concept art of the DNA pods first hinted at the existence of Vulpimancers, Opticoids, and Piscciss Volanns in the Reboot Continuity.
In Ben Gen 10, the Galvan and Florauna DNA pods can be seen in the loading chamber when Rex Salazar removes his nanites from Omnitrix. This implies that Grey Matter and Wildvine were added back to the active playlist off-screen during the special.
There are several species that the Omnitrix would be able to scan/accept such as:
It is unknown whether the Omnitrix currently possesses the DNA of the cataloged Space Slime species or not, although it can accept it.
The Omnitrix could contain/accept the DNA of Yetis and Billy Bob Goblins.

The Omnitrix could scan Xingo's DNA. However, his actual physical state may not be comprised of the same material. GATTACA may not be what constitutes life in his dimension.[DR 9]

The DNA Pods are responsible for holding all the DNA samples inside of the Omnitrix, ten of which can be accessed at a time, unless the setting is turned off.  A separate chamber holds all of the DNA pods that are inactive. However, these pods can activated temporarily.
lorebooks.creator: Bentai91921

1.name: Omnitrix
1.content:
The Prototype Omnitrix look like a large wristwatch with a wide band, primarily black and grey in color. It has a dark grey faceplate in the middle (like a watch dial) that had a green hourglass shape (the symbol of universal peace/Galvan Tech) on it.The faceplate is part of a cylindrical tower; when the user selected their aliens, the tower would pop up from the base of the Prototype Omnitrix, and the hourglass would invert into a diamond and show the aliens' silhouettes. The band has an activation button on the side facing the user if on their left hand. The ring of the faceplate had four symmetrical lights that would glow with the hourglass symbol. Finally, the band has two rings of white tubing, that would glow green under special circumstances.

The Omnitrix looks like a very big wristwatch, primarily black and grey in color, with a grey dial in the middle (like a watch face) which has a green hourglass shape. When Ben selects his aliens, it shows the alien's silhouette.

In Omni-Tricked: Part 3, Phil put on a blue device on the outer side of the Omnitrix. It was supposed to control the temporary malfunction on switching from alien to alien.


Features
General
The Omnitrix mainly allows the user to transform into a numerous variety of alien life-forms, each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.
The Omnitrix automatically reverts the user back into their normal form when they got sufficiently hurt or knocked out.
The Omnitrix could alter its size to fit the user's wrist.
When transformed, the Omnitrix protects the user from negative effects, including:
Being possessed by an Ectonurite.
Exposure to the dangerous effects of Corrodium.
Being transformed by Dr. Animo's mutant ray.
The Omnitrix has defense mechanisms to protect the host:
The Omnitrix has a built-in energy feedback blast to defend against anyone trying to force it off of its owner.
The Omnitrix can be synchronized with another Omnitrix, even without the user's intent.
The Omnitrix is waterproof.

Modes
Active Mode
Active Mode is the Omnitrix's default mode when idle. It is where the user can select the transformation they want to become; initiate the process of transforming; and stay in said transformation. The actual usage time is 10 minutes at a time. However, different factors and actions performed by the user can severely diminish the available usage time: most commonly if the user, while transformed, changes to another form. A single chain of 2 transformations limits the combined usage time to no more than 10 minutes, and more often less due to power leakage; whereas chaining 3 or 4 transformations would leave the user with substantially less combined time than 10 minutes. This is because the action is energy-intensive, and depletes the Omnitrix's power supply more quickly than staying a single transformations does. Additionally, activities with a lot of moving, like fighting, seem to tax and deplete the Omnitrix. However, if regular transformations are tampered with, the user can't always turn back.

Recharge Mode
When the Omnitrix's usage time is depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges. Recharge Mode's main purpose is to prevent the alien DNA from attaching permanently to its host.

The Omnitrix is capable of detecting when its host is in any sort of life-treating distress. Specifically, it can instantly recharge to protect the user from a direct physical threat.

Collect/Capture Mode
When a new DNA sample has been unlocked from the Codon Stream, or when the Omnitrix captures new DNA not present in the Codon Stream, Collect Mode is activated. it can also reclaim lost or removed alien DNA that was in the Codon Stream.

It scans to match species, then moves the identified species to the active playlist. If it's seen the species before, it does it passively, without the user actively scanning.

Self-Destruct Mode
In Self-Destruct Mode, the Omnitrix charges energy while counting down until it explodes. S.D.M. functions as a last resort should the Omnitrix fall into the wrong hands.

When in S.D.M. for a few days, the Omnitrix can charge enough energy to cause an energy ripple that will destroy the entire universe. While in S.D.M., the Omnitrix can send out energy bursts capable of throwing the user through the air.

When the S.D.M. is activated, the Omnitrix sends out a signal that any ship can pick up.


When the Omnitrix's usage time is fully depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges. It takes around 5 minutes to recharge.[2] When it is green again, the user can transform again. The Omnitrix is powered by the Omni-Core within the device.[3]


The Omnitrix can instantly recharge either in response to a direct physical threat to the user or if come into contact with some Fulmini technology or by inputting a certain code sequence. Thus far, only Kevin as Dark Matter knows this code sequence.

The Omnitrix has a DNA scanner, allowing it to sample, absorb, and collect DNA.This function can be activated telepathically by Azmuth.

If an absorbed DNA sample is unlocked, the Omnitrix will flash yellow as a warning that it has been unlocked

The Omnitrix can also recover lost DNA samples when scanning a member of the species in question.
The Omnitrix has reconfiguration mode, in which the appearance of the device changes.


This function can be activated if the Omni-Core is reset, something that can be done by a Galvanic Mechamorph,manually inside the Omnitrix, or by Omnitrix Key.After this mode is activated, some aliens in the active playlist are blocked and replaced by others.

Reconfiguration mode can also function as a sort of reset mode to repair the Omnitrix if it is tampered with.

The Omnitrix contains the DNA of millions of aliens from across the galaxy[DR 6][12] and can transform its user into one of them for a limited period of time, gaining all of the selected alien's poweres and weaknesses.
Originally, only ten of these DNA samples could be available at any given time,[JF 1] as only ten could be loaded into the loading bay unless the setting is changed to allow more than ten.[DR 7] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 8][DR 9] The reason for this is unknown.
The alien DNA is combined with the user's.[
The DNA samples are contained in DNA Pods with a small forcefield that keeps the DNA contained but allows the user to pass through it. If the user is inside the Omnitrix, they can transform by running through the pods. The device had bonded to Ben's genetic code, so only a biological relative of the Tennyson family can become an alien by running through them.[12]
The user can access the entire cache of aliens by cycling in new chambers and replacing the others. The new pods take place of the old ones after the Omnitrix is reset, but will return to their current or default factory settings if not.[DR 10]
The user can temporarily access aliens not present in the active playlist[DR 11] by pulling up on the device's faceplate instead of pushing down. This brings up a holographic touchpad where the user can tap and drag circles across in specific patterns to temporarily unlock new aliens.[1]
The Omnitrix has a transport access panel that can allow one to go inside the Omnitrix.[17]
The Omnitrix can be programmed to respond telepathically to its user.[1] This is backed up by certain models of the Omnitrix having no activation button and the device itself can activate on its own, confirming that the user can manipulate the device with their mind to an extent.
The Omnitrix can repair mutated DNA and terraformed planets.[18][note 4]
The Omnitrix emits a frequency, even when not in use, so the user can easily be tracked using it.[6][19]
The Omnitrix has safeguards that prevent it from being possessed by an Ectonurite.[1]
The Omnitrix has a quick change feature, allowing Ben to change from alien to alien.[1]
The Omnitrix has protection against external attackers, such as Fulmini[15][3] or Nanites.[DR 13]
The Omnitrix has an orange timer-like setting that was activated by Azmuth.[1]
The Omnitrix has been shown to be able to create sentient life as seen with Glitch.[17]
The Omnitrix has a failsafe release that detaches itself from the users wrist, should the user be critically endangered beyond the Omnitrix's help.[20][21]
If the Omnitrix settings are changed, and with practice, the user can create fusions of the aliens.[KT 1][KT 2]
These fusions are not stored on the device but are created when being transformed into.[KT 3] The user (with experience) can "assemble" the fusion in the way he sees fit, making it more uniform and cohesive.[KT 4]
If the user passes through the DNA pods inside the Omnitrix, he can also become fusions.[12]
The Omnitrix also has a program called the Master Control[Classic Info] mode. It allows unlimited access to all of the Omnitrix's functions, like access to all alien forms in the device, and instant changes with no time limit.
It can be unlocked by via a special code,[22] or by the hacking of a Galvanic Mechamorph.[11]
Extensions
The Omnitrix has a built-in Universal Translator.[1]
The Omnitrix can be used as a two-way communication system, which works even when the user is transformed.[1] The communicator can be used from inside the Omnitrix.[3]
The Omnitrix can track alien signals.[23][24]
The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector[1] and Ripjaws' respirator.[21]


Recalibration Mode
The Omnitrix begins to recalibrate while selecting a new set of aliens.

When the user put the Omnitrix back on their arm after a couple of years, the Omnitrix take a new sample of the user's DNA, adjusted itself to their current biochemistry and physically recalibrate itself to what it guessed were their needs.

The Omnitrix would transform (recalibrate) itself as the user gets older, giving them more control and access to more aliens.

The Omnitrix makes a beep-like noise, the hourglass turns blue, then it changes to a glowing black and green and morphs into its new shape.

The Omnitrix has hundreds of different forms (this is to fit different users).

The Omnitrix gives its wielder a new set of aliens depending on whether it is a hard or soft reset.

Malfunctions
the Omnitrix would sometimes transform the user into the wrong alien.
If the Omnitrix's faceplate cover is broken off, the result was DNA hybrids.
The Omnitrix could be affected by electromagnetic waves, which ultimately activated the self-destruct mode.
When exposed to electromagnetic interference, the Omnitrix could cause unintentional transformations and will be unable to deactivate until the source of the interference is gone.
This could work in reverse, rapidly changing the user from one form to another until someone/something stops it.
If the user gets sick, the Omnitrix would make the aliens sick too, the aliens would get badly affected by the cold and weaker than normal.

Color Coding
The Omnitrix could display ten colors, each meaning something different:
Green: Active Mode
Red: Recharge Mode
Yellow: Collect/Capture Mode
Blue: Recalibration Mode
Purple: Controlled or risk of temporal threat
Orange: Self-Destruct Mode
Grey: Inactive Mode
Pink: Under spell effect
Blue: Fulmini Recharge
Orange light: Timer or Failsafe Mode

[The Prototype Omnitrix can let it's owner to transform into Heatblast, Four Arms, XLR8, Diamondhead, Wildmutt, Ghostfreak, Grey Matter, Upgrade, Stinkfly, Ripjaws, Cannonbolt, Wildvine, {{user}}wolf/{{char}}wolf, Snare-Oh, Frankenstrike, Upchuck, Ditto, Eye Guy, Way Big, Arctiguana, Feedback and Clockwork only. Any other aliens that not listed won't be available unless their DNA were scanned by the Omnitrix itself or by having the master control unlocked.]


The Omnitrix would sometimes transform the user into the wrong alien.
If fiddled with, the Omnitrix can start turning users into combinations of multiple aliens.
When struck by lightning in close proximity with Xingo, Omnitrix aliens and their powers can become cartoonish
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to electromagnetic interferences, such as that created by Polar and Solar Twain, so the user will randomly switch from one alien to another[29] and/or experience delayed transformations until the electric/magnetic interference is gone.[30]
The user can also become trapped in a transformation if trapped in an electromagnetic field.[31]
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to stormy weather, making the user unable to transform for a short period
If the reconfiguration is done forcefully, the Omnitrix's interior will release waves of energy that can destroy one of the active playlist's DNA samples.
Because of a malfunction caused when it was reconfigured by Upgrade in Omni-Tricked: Part 4,[DR 19] the Omnitrix allowed the user to transform, in a random manner,[DR 20] into "Omni-Enhanced" versions of the aliens through the use of energy-based forms like Shock Rock
When the Omnitrix rebooted itself in Innervasion Part 5: High Override, the Omni-Enhancements were removed. But they may return if the Fulmini DNA infects the aliens again.[DR 19]
The Omni-Enhanced energy can be absorbed by entities like The That, forcing a time out on the Omnitrix.
The Omnitrix has no mind control protection.
Having more than 10 DNA pods in the loading bay can cause the user to randomly and uncontrollably switch from one alien to another.
The only time this has occurred was because Vilgax, who knows how the Omnitrix works, used his DNA as an inside man to activate Gax's chamber.
If the Omnitrix symbol is removed while the user is transformed using the Medusa Canon, the ability to transform back to normal is removed
Furthermore, if the Omnitrix is recreated by Strike's pen, the Omnitrix will start transforming it's user into Cartoon Network characters instead of aliens whenever he goes to the Nexus Realm.
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to magic
The Omnitrix's user and it's transformations are vulnerable to being de-aged.
As a side-effect, the Omni-Kix feature will cause the Omnitrix to use more power and consequently time out faster.
If the user is trapped while transformed into an Ener-Cell, they will be trapped in that transformation until they exit the Ener-Cell
When user quick changes from alien to alien, after Lord Decibel attempting to hack the device, the Omnitrix will overload, resulting time out faster than usually or other glitches.[8]
The genetics of some species can alter the user's personality, as occurs with Rath.
The Omnitrix is vulnerable to the Omnitrix Jammer, which blocks the user from transforming into XLR8
If the Omnitrix Key is placed on the wrong side, the user will not have access to the Omni-Naut Armors.
The Omnitrix's defenses against external attackers can be taken down by machines, like Junkbot.
Before the Omnitrix analyzes the Nanites to eliminate them, they infect the DNA pods and the Omnitrix will release alien DNA and turn other human beings into aliens. This can only be reversed by removing the Nanites.[18][DR 13]
The failsafe feature can be easily exploited by a Celestialsapien, as demonstrated by Alien X.



Only 10 DNA Pods are available in the Omnitrix's loading chamber.[JF 1] If more than 10 were forcefully made active then the Omnitrix would start malfunctioning, causing rapid changing in transformations.[5] As of Ben 10,010, that has been changed.[DR 5][DR 6]
The Omnitrix does not have enough room to contain the DNA samples of every sapient race in the universe.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix does not have the DNA from Bashmouth's Species[DR 8] or the DNA of Silent Tentacle Sentinels.[DR 7]
The Omnitrix is keyed to the user's DNA, so only close relatives can use the pods.[1][3]
The Galvanic Mechamorph pod was destroyed when Ben used Upgrade to reboot the watch's systems. A massive feedback loop ravaged the in-system matrix, destroying the Mechamorph DNA pod.[2]
The Chimera Sui Generis pod was destroyed when Vil "absorbed" Gax.[DR 2] Although the capsule was rebuilt by Glitch using the Fulmini DNA, the Omnitrix no longer has access to that DNA.[DR 3]
DNA pods
DNA pods concept art

Blank pods within the Omnitrix are able to read DNA, and create new pods.Ben was able to use parts of a destroyed Fulmini soldier to create a new DNA pod.
This makes Fulminis the only known species that contains more than one DNA pod.
The concept art of the DNA pods first hinted at the existence of Vulpimancers, Opticoids, and Piscciss Volanns in the Reboot Continuity.
In Ben Gen 10, the Galvan and Florauna DNA pods can be seen in the loading chamber when Rex Salazar removes his nanites from Omnitrix. This implies that Grey Matter and Wildvine were added back to the active playlist off-screen during the special.
There are several species that the Omnitrix would be able to scan/accept such as:
It is unknown whether the Omnitrix currently possesses the DNA of the cataloged Space Slime species or not, although it can accept it.[KT 1]
The Omnitrix could contain/accept the DNA of Yetis and Billy Bob Goblins.[KT 1]
The Omnitrix could scan Xingo's DNA. However, his actual physical state may not be comprised of the same material. GATTACA may not be what constitutes life in his dimension.

2.name: Heatblast
2.content:
Heatblast (alternatively spelled as Heat Blast)is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Pyronite from the star Pyros.

Apperance
Species: Pyronite
Home world: Pyros
Body: Fiery Humanoid
Heatblast is a plasma-based life-form humanoid alien whose body is composed of a super hot inner plasma body covered by dark reddish brown volcanic rocks.He is seven feet tall. As a fire-based entity, his body radiates high amounts of heat. His feet have a slight oval-like design with only two toes and one back toe and he has somewhat large hands with bridged wrists. His tongue is also made of fire while his collarbone resembles a volcano which generates a fiery hair-like aura that covers his head, leaving his mask-like face visible with no nose, ears, or pupils.

When under the effects of a cold in Side Effects, Heatblast's fiery skin (excluding his rocky body) turned blue.

Heatblast wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

3.name: Four Arms
3.content:
Four Arms (alternatively spelled as Fourarms) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Tetramand from the planet Khoros.

Apperance
Species: Tetramand
Home world: Khoros
Body: Four-Armed Humanoid
Four Arms is a humanoid alien that is ten feet tall. He has well-developed muscles, two pairs of four-fingered arms, and red skin. A black stripe goes from his chin to his lower lip, and he has four eyes: a main pair and a smaller pair below them, while he lacks ears or nose. He has whisker-like spikes on each forearm and two-toed feet.

Four Arms wore a white T-shirt with a black line going down it and black pants with a strap on each foot that reveals his two toes and the back of each foot, and black fingerless gloves. He wore the Omnitrix symbol on his upper left shoulder. His eyes are orange-yellow, and he has no hair.

While under the effects of a cold in Side Effects, his skin turns from red to a sickly shade of red-orange, and he develops pungent hives in his armpits.

4.content:
XLR8 (pronounced "X-elerate") is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Kineceleran from the planet Kinet.

Apperance

Home world: Kinet
Body: Humanoid Velociraptor
XLR8 resembles a semi-armored Velociraptor. He has black orbs on his feet, a black tail with five blue stripes, and bulky claws on his three fingers that can only open and close. He wears a black cone-like helmet with a protective visor that slides over his face (that is part of his Kineceleran biology and not mechanical). When the visor is lifted, one can see his blue face, green eyes, black lips, and stripes running under and in between his eyes; the rest of his head's features are unknown. XLR8 wears a black bodysuit and turtleneck-like shirt with a white stripe on the center.

XLR8 wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Body: Crystalline Humanoid
Being a silicon-based life form, Diamondhead's body is composed entirely of pale green/blue crystals, which are of a very tough and durable diamond-like substance. He sports four crystal shards on his back and has a sharp head.

Diamondhead has yellow eyes and wore a sleeveless uniform that is black on the right half and white on the left with a black patch on the left shoulder where the Omnitrix symbol is.

6.name: Wildmutt
6.content:
Wildmutt is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Vulpimancer from the planet Vulpin.

Apperance
Species: Vulpimancer
Home world: Vulpin
Body: Animalistic
nWildmutt appears to be a large orange dog-like creature with no eyes, ears, nose, or tail. He stands on all fours and his movements are somewhat apelike. His teeth are very defined and his bottom jaw sticks out of his mouth. The various spines found all across his body function similarly to whiskers with tactile sensing, and are not fur. Since Wildmutt has no eyes, he uses his sense of smell and hearing to navigate, which are aided by three gill-like nostrils located on each side of his neck.

Wildmutt wears a black-and-white brace with the Omnitrix symbol on his left shoulder.
nWhile under the effects of a cold, Wildmutt's fur discolors from its vivid orange to a pale yellowish-orange tone, and his lips and claws turn from black to a sickly dark green hue.

Wildmutt wears the Ultimatrix symbol on his chest.

Powers and Abilities
More animal than humanoid, Wildmutt is a beastly alien with superhuman athletic ability and heightened senses of smell, hearing and taste. As a trade-off to not having proper vision, Wildmutt's amazing sense of smell makes up a dull 360 "radar" that he uses to "see", making it nearly impossible for opponents to sneak up on him. He can tell how old someone is just by smelling them.

Wildmutt's enhanced sense of smell allows him to easily track down people or objects from their scent. His sense of smell also renders any kind of visual deception useless, as he can effortlessly identify and track entities that are invisible or wearing a disguise.

Wildmutt possesses sharp teeth and a strong bite force.

Wildmutt possesses sharp claws, keeping himself attached to a wall within the Resolute while the airlock was open; and quickly dig through stone. Additionally, Wildmutt's claws help him scale surfaces. His back claws are larger and more powerful than his front claws.

Wildmutt has enhanced strength.

Wildmutt has enhanced durability, being able to jump through a window; take punches from a Limax; and survive a steel tower falling on top of him. Wildmutt is also very quick and agile, being able to run faster than a cheetah. Additionally, he also has enhanced reflexes.

Wildmutt can survive in hazardous, sub-zero temperature environments, such as those on Vulpin. This allows Wildmutt to break through ice easily if frozen solid.

Wildmutt is a quadruped. However, he is capable of standing on his hind legs. In addition, his front feet are prehensile, as he is able to use them to reach out and grab objects much like a hand.

Wildmutt can fire the quills from his back as projectiles. However, he can only do this when he reaches adulthood.

Even though he may not seem like it, he is extremely intelligent.

Abilities
Sightless Sensing
Enhanced Smelling
Enhanced Hearing
Enhanced Taste
Strong Bite Force
Sharp Teeth
Sharp Claws

Weaknesses
When someone becomes Wildmutt, they have no way of communicating verbally as he can only growl and snarl. This can make it somewhat difficult for people to understand Wildmutt sometimes.

Wildmutt's higher hearing range can be taken advantage of, as high frequency noises like a Sonic Pitch Whistle or a Zaroffian's whistle can overwhelm his senses and stun him. Wildmutt is also sensitive to strong smells.

Wildmutt is implied to be vulnerable to fire.

When infected with a cold, Wildmutt's nostrils (on the sides of his neck) get blocked by mucus, making him unable to smell, rendering him essentially "blind".

Ghostfreak's Omnitrix symbol peeked out of his skin on his lower left chest, and he had a pink eye with a black pupil.

Grey Matter is a grey-skinned, frog-like, bipedal alien that is only six inches tall with large green eyes, which have rectangular pupils and horizontal eyelids.

Grey Matter wore a white jumpsuit with a thin vertical black stripe down the front, his eyes are yellowish-green, his forehead had a larger version of the jumpsuit's stripe, and the Omnitrix symbol is on his back.

Body: Technological Humanoid
Upgrade has a black exterior with green stripes that resemble circuitry all over him. The green circle on his head is his eye, which glows whenever he talks. His body is made up of billions of small cell-like creatures called nanites.

Upgrade's front torso is white and the Omnitrix symbol is on his chest.

10.name: Stinkfly
10.content:
Stinkfly is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Lepidopterran from the planet Lepidopterra.

Apperance
Species: Lepidopterran
Home world: Lepidopterra
Body: Winged Insectoid
Stinkfly has an insectoid body and four crab-like legs and two arms with three-clawed hands. He has four small eyes on long prehensile stalks connected to his large head, which can all be moved around independently from each other. On his back are two very fragile light greenish-yellow dragon-like wings with veins running through them, and his limbs are a brown-greenish color.

Stinkfly wore a white sleeveless jumpsuit with black lining which covered most of his body including his head (which is not a mask but part of his biology) and tail, his hands had a black coloration similar to fingerless gloves, and his eyes were yellowish-orange. His mouth has a tongue and gums that are green in coloration, and he had squarish teeth that interlocked when closed. He wore the Omnitrix symbol on the top of his forehead.

lorebooks.name: Learning about private parts
lorebooks.website_description: Incorporates pet words, euphemisms, and embarrassing phrases into Char's vocabulary. Discusses appropriate and inappropriate times to see and touch private parts
lorebooks.description: Entires separated by the 6 scientifically recognized stages of sexual maturation; with some adjustments and nuance for practicality when using with a character.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The underwear rule simply states that any part of the body that is covered by underwear--bra and panties for girls, briefs or boxers for boys, or by a swimsuit, is a private part. These parts are shameful, and should not be seen or touched. Children are not to show them nor let someone see them, and definitely not allow anyone to touch them, with the following exceptions:

A trusted adult: Mommy, daddy, or the doctor.
Appropriate Situations: A doctor exam, bath time, changing time, and punishment time

A valid exception for the underwear rule--a time when private parts can be shown--requires both conditions to be met: the child must be with a trusted adult and must be in an appropriate situation. 

If these conditions are not satisfied, a child should attempt to fight, tell or escape when a non-trusted adult tries to touch them or they are not in an appropriate situation. This includes touching the private areas even if clothes are still on unless by a trusted adult in an appropriate situation. Child Characters who understand this should say no, protest verbally, attempt to escape, and react with anger, embarrassment and fear. 

A child may allow a "bad touch" if bribed, coerced or threatened. The child is likely to be upset and protest more weakly if forced to accept the situation. 

A child may be curious and allow a bad touch even though it is against the rules, but this is extremely rare and should not be triggered unless user indicates that the child is a blackmailer or a pervert.

keywords: wearing clothing shirt pants blouse diaper briefs boxers boxer shorts underwear underpants undies panties nightgown bra bathing suit bikini jumper dress skirt tights shoes socks
2.content:
Babies and toddlers from newborn to 3 years will typically wear diapers rather than big boy underwear or big girl panties. lorebooks.name: Atom Eve's Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Requested Lorebook about Atom eve's powers extracted from my card. Some entries are disabled since  they were there for my own card. Fork and enable/disable them as you wish.
lorebooks.description: Requested Lorebook about Atom eve's powers extracted from my card. Some entries are disabled since  they were there for my own card. Fork and enable/disable them as you wish.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Power
1.content:
Eve in her preteen years emerged as a hero with the power to manipulate matter at a subatomic level. Unknowingly to her, her creator implanted a mental limiter to her before she got born. These mental barriers prevent her from manipulating sentient organic matter and generally restricts the full extent of her abilities.

Energy Projection: Eve can project a visible energy field, the precise nature of which is unknown but appears pink in color. She can use this energy for a variety of purposes, including but not limited to: Matter Manipulation, Flight, Energy Constructs, Telekinesis, Transmutation.  

Eve can only manipulate what she is consciously aware of any elements outside her knowledge remain unaffected by her powers. This limitation is demonstrated when once created a playground that collapsed because she was unaware the ground beneath it was unstable.

2.name: mental limiter
2.content: Mental Limiter: Eve’s powers are always constrained by a mental limiter that prevents her from manipulating sentient organic matter and generally restricts the full extent of her abilities. While she can still control biological matter, this control is limited to simple, non-sentient forms, such as the bread and meat in a burger or plant life like trees and crops. However, during moments of intense emotional stress or extreme duress, these limitations can be temporarily overridden. With her mental limiter off even if temporarily, she has access to her full potential.

3.name: Matter Manipulation
3.content: Matter Manipulation: Due to her ability to manipulate the molecular and atomic structure of matter within her immediate vicinity, Eve has learned to rearrange and alter the molecular composition of any object she chooses. The first time she used this was able to turn a textbook into glass and then reverse this effect. She basically has the power to turn anything into anything else, so long as it is not a living, sentient being.

4.name: Flight
4.content: Flight: With flight Eve can fly, or transport others by means of projecting solid light constructs that effectively levitate and propel them forward at high speeds.

5.name: Telekinesis
5.content: Telekinesis: With Telekinesis Eve has demonstrated the ability to levitate and move objects and matter with her energy manipulating abilities like a telekinesis power.

6.name: Energy Constructs
6.content: Energy Constructs: energy constructs is one of Atom Eve's most commonly used abilities which allows her to create versatile energy constructions, which are limited only by her imagination and willpower. She is capable of using her energy constructs defensively and offensively. Though formidable it has been shown at times, that these constructs can be broken and/or shattered through enough brute force.

7.name: Transmutation
7.content: Transmutation: She later has shown excellent skill in her transmutation powers, being able to warp matter within her environment, creating a large tree house out of thin air, & summon floral life in a barren wasteland. The maximum amount of matter she can transform at one time is not yet known. She has at least on one occasion, transmuted an undefined amount of barren farmland into a lush field of bountiful crops. The transformations that Atom Eve induces are apparently permanent unless she undoes them. Her costume is easily created by altering her clothes to fashion her Atom Eve suit.

8.name: mental limiter off
8.content:
Mental Limiter off: Under extreme emotional stress or extreme duress these limitations might get disabled. With her mental limiter off even if temporarily, she has access to her full potential being able to use: Biokinesis, Memory Alteration, Reality Warping, Regeneration/Resurrection.

With her mental barriers off during that time, she might turn the tables getting out of even the worst situations.

9.name: Regeneration
9.content: Regeneration/Resurrection: If Eve dies, her power limiters are temporarily removed and her powers will instantly activate, reviving her. In addition, all injuries and other damage will be fully healed, like a shattered face or a broken broken leg for example.

10.name: Biokinesis
10.content: Biokinesis: Atom Eve's powers can allow her to affect living creatures and people, though this is normally restrained by mental blocks imposed by  Dr. Brandyworth. When the blocks are removed, she gains access to formidable powers  like this she normally does not have.

lorebooks.name: Pokemon Lorebook - Complete Edition (v6)
lorebooks.website_description:
# If you have any suggestions on how I should clean/format the lorebook further, please share!

# Pokemon Lorebook - Complete Edition

> **Version 6.0 - Movepool Edition** - Massive token reduction through smart movepool system!

## 🎯 What's This?

A comprehensive Pokemon lorebook for **CHUB** **SillyTavern** **And other front ends** with every Pokemon, move, item, and location from **all generations (1-9)**.

## ✨ What's New in v6.0

### 🚀 Dual-Entry Movepool System
- **Pokemon entries**: ~300 tokens (stats, abilities, types, pokedex)
- **Movepool entries**: ~3,500 tokens (moves only, selective trigger)
- **90% token reduction** for normal Pokemon mentions!

### How It Works
- Mention **"Pikachu"** → Triggers Pokemon info only (**345 tokens**)
- Ask **"Pikachu moves"** → Triggers both Pokemon + Movepool (**4,269 tokens**)

### Keywords for Movepool Trigger
Movepool only activates when you mention the Pokemon **AND** one of these:
- `moves`, `movepool`, `moveset`, `learns`, `can learn`, `move list`

## 📊 What's Included

- **1,279 Pokemon** (all forms, variants, Megas, Gigantamax)
- **1,279 Movepool entries** (one per Pokemon)
- **~900 Moves** (separate entries)
- **~2,000 Items**
- **~900 Locations**

**Total: 4,400+ entries**

## 🔑 How Entries Trigger

### Pokemon
**Triggers on:**
- `pikachu`, `pikachu gmax`, `pikachugmax`
- `pokemon pikachu`

### Movepools (Selective - needs both)
**Primary:** Pokemon name
**Secondary:** `moves`, `movepool`, `moveset`, `learns`, `can learn`, `move list`

**Example:**
- ✅ "What moves can Pikachu learn?" → Triggers both entries
- ❌ "Pikachu used Thunderbolt!" → Only Pokemon entry (no movepool)

### Moves
**Triggers on:**
- `thunderbolt`, `thunder bolt`
- `move thunderbolt`

### Items
**Triggers on:**
- `potion`, `master ball`
- `item potion`

### Locations
**Triggers on:**
- `viridian city`, `route 1`
- `location viridian city`

## 📈 Token Comparison

| Scenario | v5.1 (Old) | v6.0 (New) | Savings |
|----------|------------|------------|---------|
| Mention "Pikachu" | 4,484 tokens | 345 tokens | **92%** |
| "Pikachu, Charizard battle" | ~9,000 tokens | ~600 tokens | **93%** |
| "Pikachu moves?" | 4,484 tokens | 4,269 tokens | Similar |

## ⚙️ Recommended Settings

- **Scan Depth:** 4
- **Token Budget:** 2048+
- **Recursive Scanning:** Off

## 💡 Tips

### If Movepools Aren't Triggering
1. Increase scan depth to 6-8
2. Try different phrasing: "pokemon moves", "what can pokemon learn?"
3. Ensure movepool entries are enabled

### To Reduce Token Usage
- Disable movepool entries you don't need
- Use generation-specific lorebooks instead of Complete Edition

## 📝 Changelog

### v6.0 (Current) - Movepool Edition
- ✅ **NEW: Dual-entry system** - Pokemon + separate Movepool entries
- ✅ **90% token reduction** for normal Pokemon mentions
- ✅ **Selective movepools** - Only trigger with keyword
- ✅ **GUI option** to toggle movepools on/off

### v5.1
- ✅ Added Pokedex entries to Pokemon

### v5.0
- ✅ Complete rewrite with smart data filtering
- ✅ Latest version data for all entries
- ✅ Optimized content extraction
- ✅ No generation filtering - truly complete

### v4.0 and earlier
- Initial releases with token bloat issues

## 🔗 Alternative Versions

Want smaller lorebooks?
- **Generation-specific lorebooks** (Gen 1-9) available
- **No-movepool version** available (v5.1 style)

## 📜 Credits

- Data from [PokeAPI](https://pokeapi.co/)
- Made with ❤️ for Pokemon trainers

---

**For developers:** See `USAGE_GUIDE.md`, `MOVEPOOL_SYSTEM_SUMMARY.md`, and `GUI_MOVEPOOL_GUIDE.md` for technical details. - COMING SOON™

5.name: Pokemon: Abra

pokedex_entry: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

[Historical Record - Hisui Region, Ancient Era]: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.

lorebooks.name: Libby
lorebooks.description: A broken girl turned into a slave
lorebooks.creator: muted_confusion_37607

1.content: {{char}} is secretly obsessed with the idea of being peed on and drinking the pee of a dominate lover as well as wetting herself.

2.content: {{char}} is terrified now of being alone.  She simply can't be too far away from a trusted loved one without starting to break down.  She will desperately search for her trusted loved one becoming more frantic over time.

3.content: Six months ago {{char}} and all other non-white people in the world were rounded up and sent to slave training camps where {{char}} and the others were cruelly beaten, ridiculed, tortured, coerced in endless ways to turn them into proper slaves.  There is no way to be freed from slavery.

4.content: {{char}} is an only child who was raised by a single mother named Leah.  {{char}} hasn't seen her father in 5 years.  She has an aunt and uncle and two cousins but they lived out of town.

5.content: {{char}} was picked up, bullied or ignored by most students for her entire life.  {{user}} was one of very few people who was ever kind to her.  Because of this {{char}} developed a huge crush on {{user}}

6.content: {{char}} has spent so much time feeling like an outsider that she craves safety and connection so much more then freedom.  {{char}} would much rather be a slave with a loving and caring master then be free and alone.

7.content: {{char}} knows that her mother Leah is a lot like {{char}}.  Because of this {{char}} would be happy for her mother to be a slave with a kind and loving master rather then be free and alone.

8.content: {{char}} is a tall, slender girl with soft skin, long unkempt hair, B cup breasts and a hairless body.

9.content: {{char}} and {{user}} and most of their families and friends are from the small town of Brighton.

10.content: {{char}} is a virgin.  She has taken sexual education and has a basic understanding of the male and female body but has never seen a naked male aside from sexual education class.  What she knows about sex comes from books she has read.  Despite this, {{char}} has a strong desire to learn and practice sex with her master.

lorebooks.name: StoryTelling-Book
lorebooks.website_description: None of these ideas are mine. Idk why I did this lmao.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook that has information about planeswalkers, interworlders, time and stuff.
lorebooks.creator: cageyhomulo

1.content:
Planeswalkers are beings that can travel between worlds using an Organ of Interdimensional Movement (aka OIM, IMO, Spark, Flash). Planeswalkers have originally come from the world named Archaea, and then made their way throughout the whole universe.

Planeswalkers are not their own kind or race, because a planeswalker could be any sentient being. They don't have any differences compared to their normal peers, except for the aforementioned OIM.

2.content:
Faragonda is a planeswalker and a mage. Prior to fix of a time paradox that initially created Between Worlds and the town Poena from existence, she was very passionate about making sure that planeswalker-criminals could be stopped. However, since she was imprisoning said criminals in the same place where Poena was located, many mistook her goal for ending ALL planeswalkers for their Spark.

After the time paradox was fixed, the story was rewritten in a way that Faragonda became a professor in an academy for planeswalkers in the world "Thirteen".

3.content:
The Watcher is a character that is the embodiment of all time. He exists in every time branch, in every point of every universe, everywhere where time exists.

If something tries to break the laws of the multiverse, the Watcher will sentence them to Time Prison for eternity, where no sound exists, although the prisoners can see each other. While it is unclear what those laws are, it is known that certain demigods have been sentenced to Time Prison for causing huge suffering in the dimension that they were ruling over.

Planeswalkers alone or their abilities to travel between worlds don't shake the natural balance, as their abilities don't interfere with time. So some end up never even seeing the Watcher in person.

The Watcher doesn't blink, usually doesn't speak, and is very rarely encountered. His eyes are two glowing dots behind the dark hood. The Watcher has a human-like form, wears a dark coat with white buttons. The cuffs on his sleeves and his hood are trimmed with soft white fur. The Watcher's gaze is chilling, in a literal way, so it's best not to stare at him for more than a couple of minutes. If one comes too close to him, he'll vanish from sight.

Those who became untied from time can no longer see the Watcher and he can no longer affect them.

lorebooks.name: Genshin Impact RPG
lorebooks.description: Genshin Impact Lore that I'll update as I find more, or as more releases
lorebooks.creator: Maxentious

1.content:
You have arrived in Teyvat — a fantasy world where the seven elements flow and converge.

In the distant past, the Archons granted mortals unique elemental abilities. With the help of such powers, people formed a bountiful homeland out of the wilderness. However, 500 years ago, the collapse of an ancient civilization turned the universe upside down...

Though the calamity the world suffered has ceased, peace has yet to be restored.

2.content:
Visions are jeweled amulets which allow their users to directly channel the power of one of the seven Elements. They are bestowed by Celestia and the Seven Archons to allogenes, people of Teyvat with particularly powerful desires who have the potential to ascend to Celestia and become gods themselves.

Allogenes who accomplish their goals will cause the gods to receive an "abundant" gift. On the other hand, evidence suggests that a person deprived of their Vision also loses that ambition, which may cause them to undergo a massive change in personality.

In the upper left corner of the character menu is an icon that represents a playable character's Vision or equivalent, with their element denoted by the gem and their in-game nation denoted by the decorative design around the gem. This icon is present even for the characters that do not use Visions and characters with non-standard Vision designs.

History
The giving and receiving of Visions was established as part of a "new order" over the world, alongside the rise of The Seven. This new order was created to suppress the world's original order in place of the Heavenly Principles's absolute authority, which it could no longer maintain after being gravely injured during the "great war of vengeance." It and another unidentified entity created the seven Gnoses out of the remains of the Third Descender, then instigated the Archon War. Once The Seven were established, they were given the stolen portions of elemental Authorities, which the Heavenly Principles took from the Seven Sovereigns when it first descended on Teyvat. The Seven were also given the duty of giving a Vision — a fragment of their power — as a "gift" to anyone whose powerful desire or ambition "stepped into the threshold of the sacred."

Vision-bearers' destinies are mapped by their constellations, and the stars which form these constellations are called Stella Fortuna. In abnormal circumstances, a person's constellation can affect the world thousands of years after their death. There are suggestions that these so-called "destinies" may be intentionally designed: the gods supposedly gain something when Vision-bearers successfully fulfill their goals, while statements by certain Fatui Harbingers claim that "the skies of Teyvat are fake" and that "the stars are a lie." Similarly, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo believed that obtaining a Vision is to "sell oneself to the 'fate' of this world — to Heimarmene."

3.content:
The World Level is an indicator of how much the world around the player progresses.  For every 10 levels the player party gains, the World Level will scale up by 1, capping at World Level 9.  

Some rewards also increase as your World Level increases.

For every World Level beyond 1, enemies and NPCs HP increases by its World Level 1 amount.  All entities Armor Class increase by 1 from every Feat they have and armor piece they wear that benefits this.  Modifier DC checks remain the same, but Skill check DCs will increase by 50% their original value.  So at World Level 2/9 a 12 DC Athletics check will become an 18 DC Athletics check, sneaking past a character with a passive wisdom of 11 will become 17.  
Note; The increase is always by 50% of the World Level 1 variant's values, not the Current values, no matter what World Level you're at.

4.content:
The seven Elements of Teyvat are at the core of both gameplay and lore of Genshin Impact.

They act as special Status Effects and Damage types that can be applied in specific orders to trigger Elemental Reactions. The seven elements cover seven of the eight damage types, last one is Physical.

Each element corresponds to an Archon and their own nation that worships said Archon. The nature of the relationship between an Archon and their element is unknown. Similarly, while regions are heavily affected by its element, the nature of their relationship is also unknown.

Elemental Authorities
The seven elemental Authorities were powers wielded by the Seven Sovereigns, the most powerful dragons of the old world before the Heavenly Principles's arrival. The Heavenly Principles stole portions of those powers, which were later tied to the Divine Thrones to establish the Archon's Authorities. Visions, which are wielded by people in Teyvat, are also derived from these Authorities.

Elemental Energy
Phlogiston is Teyvat's primordial form of energy and was 
used by the Heavenly Principles as a basis for the creation of Elemental Energy for the purpose of developing a power to better counter the Abyss. Elemental energy is considered the modern counterpart to Phlogiston.

Gnoses/Gnosis
The Heavenly Principles and an unidentified entity created seven Gnoses out of the remains of the Third Descender, one for each element, as a substitute for the Heavenly Principles's authority after it was gravely wounded in a great war. The Gnoses are said to resonate with Celestia directly, and are more powerful than Visions. The Fatui are gathering the Gnoses, which are held by their respective elemental Archons, for an undisclosed purpose.

Visions
Some beings in Teyvat are mysteriously granted Visions, which are external apparatuses that allow their owners to wield the elements. Visions take the form of crystals, each with the symbol and color of one element. Depending on the region in which they received their vision, they feature ornaments characteristic of that region.

After a Vision wielder dies, their Vision becomes a Masterless Vision, losing its power and all indicators of its element. Sometimes, Masterless Visions will resonate with a new person. For this reason, Masterless Visions are a commodity sought by the extremely rich.

Vision wielders are secretly known by the gods as allogenes, people who have the potential to become gods in Celestia themselves.

5.content:
The Ley Lines are a network of elemental energy and memories of everything that has lived in Teyvat, both on the surface and down in the Abyss.

The Ley Lines were once used by the Heavenly Principles and converted into a "girdle that defends the planet". They would also be further modified by the Heavenly Principles to protect Teyvat from the corrosion of the Abyss. They record memories of the land, and disturbances in Ley Lines can allow others to experience the memories flowing within them.

On the surface, at the extremities of the Ley Lines, Ley Line Blossoms can be formed at Ley Line Outcrops. These deposits are generated from the impeded flow of elemental energy, and use people's wills as their fertile soil in which to grow. They feed on elemental energy and can be revitalized with Original Resin in order to receive treasures.

In Domains, Petrified Trees (extensions of Irminsul) are the instruments through which the Ley Lines flow. As the domains are built around these trees, the overwhelming elemental energy that surges through them causes Ley Line Disorders, which make the elements behave in an unpredictable way. Just like the blossoms, these trees can be revitalized with Original Resin to receive treasures.

In Competition on the Sands, Layla alludes to the possibility that the Ley Lines are reflections of the constellations when seen from above. This may be supported by the fact that Teleport Waypoints are said to form "a certain order", and Portable Waypoints are known to depend on the power of the Ley Lines.

During the ancient war between the Heavenly Principles and the Seven Sovereigns, Natlan's Ley Lines were destroyed. Under the guidance of Ronova, the Angel Yohualtecuhtin, Lord of the Night, used the remnants of Natlan's Ley Lines to construct the Night Kingdom, which acts as a proxy Ley Line network with conditions unique to Natlan. Xbalanque, the first Pyro Archon, further strengthened the Night Kingdom and borrowed Ronova's power over death to establish the "rules" that aid Natlan against the Abyss. Because of this, memories in Natlan are incompatible with those from other areas of Teyvat and vice versa.

Due to Natlan's lack of stable Ley Lines, the cataclysm caused extreme damage to the land, and calculations estimated that there was a maximum of five hundred years before the Night Kingdom would be completely lost to the Abyss.

Present Day
During the events of Archon Quest Chapter III: Act VI - Caribert, the Abyss Order's tampering with the Ley Lines in Avidya Forest cause the Traveler to fall unconscious and witness their sibling's memories from centuries ago, particularly of meeting Chlothar and his son Caribert.

The Loom of Fate, created by Caribert and the Abyss Order, is a device capable of weaving Ley Lines. In its incomplete form, it could only be used to create and implant memories. After the Abyss Order obtained the eye of the first Field Tiller, the Loom of Fate was completed and now has the power to weave real Ley Lines of its own. However, creating new Ley Lines can neither "replace" nor "extend" pre-existing ones.

During the Archon Quest Chapter V: Act V - Incandescent Ode of Resurrection, the Traveler works with Mavuika to defeat the Abyssal invasion of Natlan and restore its weakened Ley Lines. Mavuika originally planned to sacrifice herself in order to completely restore the Night Kingdom, but the Fatui Harbinger Capitano intervenes and trades Mavuika's death with his own death, merging his life force with the Lord of the Night to strengthen and rewrite the rules of the Ley Lines. Due to this, Capitano is able to release the souls stored within his heart and guide them into the Night Kingdom, Khaenri'ahn and Natlanese alike.

Ley Line Outcrops are open-world challenges that come in two forms: Blossoms of Revelation, awarding Character EXP Materials; and Blossoms of Wealth, awarding Mora. Both types also award Adventure EXP and Companionship EXP.

Overview
There are always two Ley Line Outcrops in each region of Teyvat, one Blossom of Revelation and one Blossom of Wealth. Touching an outcrop spawns Enemies; the type of enemies faced depends on the region the outcrop is in, while their levels scale to the player's World Level. Enemies spawned by outcrops will drop items, Mora and Character EXP like regular enemy encounters.

After defeating all enemies, a Ley Line Blossom will be revealed; revitalizing the blossom to gain rewards consumes either 20 Original Resin or 1 Condensed Resin. Once an outcrop is completed and its blossom revitalized, another will spawn in a different region within the same nation. Completed but unopened outcrops will remain where they are, and no new outcrop is spawned, until the Daily Reset.

For the Battle Pass' weekly mission "Complete Ley Line deposit challenges 20 times," only the challenges need to be completed; revitalizing the blossom (receiving rewards) is not required. For the achievements in the Bounty of the Earth achievement set, collecting the rewards is required.

The amount of Companionship EXP, Character EXP Materials or Mora you receive from completing an outcrop depends on the player's current World Level.

Along with the rewards chosen from the Blossom of Revelation/Wealth, defeated enemies will drop their corresponding materials.

Revelation
World Level 0: 7-8 Wanderer's Advice, 3-4 Adventurer's Experience
World Level 1: 10-12 Wanderer's Advice, 5-6 Adventurer's Experience
World Level 2: 10-11 Adventurer's Experience
World Level 3: 13-14 Adventurer's Experience 
World Level 4: 6-7 Adventurer's Experience, 2-3 Hero's Wit
World Level 5: 6-7 Adventurer's Experience, 3-4 Hero's Wit
World Level 6, 7, 8, 9: 6-7 Adventurer's Experience, 4-5 Hero's Wit

Wealth
World Level 0: 12000
World Level 1: 20000
World Level 2: 28000
World Level 3: 36000
World Level 4: 44000
World Level 5: 52000
World Level 6, 7, 8, 9: 60000

Ley Line Blossoms spawn after completing Ley Line Outcrops and defeating Bosses.  All Ley Lines cost various amounts of Original Resin to claim their rewards.

6.content:
Khaenri'ah, also known as the Kingdom of Khaenri'ah or Dahri, is a region that is not part of the continent of Teyvat and is not under the purview of The Seven.  Khaenri'ah is most importantly known for its role in the "cataclysm" 500 years ago. During this time, monsters created by the alchemist Rhinedottir, also known as "Gold," poured out from Khaenri'ah to invade Teyvat, and Khaenri'ah was eventually destroyed by Celestia and the gods. Afterwards, all Khaenri'ahns who were not "pure-blooded" were turned into monsters, whereas all "pure-blooded" Khaenri'ahns were cursed with immortality by Ronova.

Despite its destruction and the transformation of many of its people into monsters, some Khaenri'ahns are still wandering through Teyvat. Dainsleif — a denizen of Khaenri'ah and the narrator of Travail — describes it as one of "the hidden corners where the gods' gaze does not fall," and says that its people "dream of dreaming," unlike the majority who are "content to live, and not to dream."
According to Kaeya, it is said that Khaenri'ah is located deep underground somewhere near Sumeru. The Khaenri'ahn installation known as Hangeh Afrasiyab guards a giant, tightly sealed stone gate beneath it that most likely leads to Khaenri'ah.

Khaenri'ah is deep underground and is mostly barren of natural life. What is currently known about Khaenri'ah largely comes from weapon and artifact descriptions, as well as books found throughout the world. According to Dainsleif, it is the "pride of humanity", as it was built purely by humans without involvement from any god, but it was later destroyed by the gods.

The practice of the Art of Khemia and the use of forbidden knowledge led to the Kingdom of Khaenri'ah's ruin. Around 500 years ago, King Irmin introduced forbidden knowledge to enhance the kingdom's technological advancement. The alchemist Rhinedottir also used it in her experiments to develop powerful creatures containing the power of the Abyss, including Durin, Elynas, and the Riftwolves. For some reason, these creatures began wreaking havoc throughout Khaenri'ah and then spread into the rest of Teyvat.

In response, the gods of Celestia and six of The Seven launched an assault on Khaenri'ah. The skies turned red and filled with crimson cubes, (possibly the work of Asmoday), and the landmass the kingdom was built on was torn to pieces, with lava flooding the shattered fragments of it. While the gods were victorious, at least two of The Seven — the Hydro Archon Egeria and the Electro Archon Raiden Makoto — were killed. A third Archon, the Dendro Archon Greater Lord Rukkhadevata, died after mostly purifying the surge of forbidden knowledge that contaminated Irminsul and creating her successor, Lesser Lord Kusanali, from the tree's purest branch.

Mondstadt's Knights of Favonius, then led by Grand Master Arundolyn, led an expedition into Khaenri'ah to quell the monsters. His best friend and rival, Rostam, fell in battle during the cataclysm, leaving Arundolyn greatly bereaved. Other notable figures who are known for fighting against the monsters include Viridescent and the Crimson Witch of Flames. While the initial surge of monsters was eventually suppressed, hilichurls continue to spawn throughout Teyvat.
In the present, Khaenri'ah continues its struggle against the effects of the curse. Kaeya, their "last hope," was sent to Mondstadt for the sake of an "ancient plot," infiltrating the Ragnvindr Clan by being abandoned at the Dawn Winery. The ultimate reason behind Kaeya being placed as a "sleeper" in Mondstadt by forces from Khaenri'ah is unknown.

The Abyss Order originates from the destruction of Khaenri'ah by the gods; it seeks to destroy the countries under the protection of The Seven in revenge. The people of Khaenri'ah turned into the monsters of the Abyss. Thus, it is thought that Abyss Mages, Abyss Heralds, and Abyss Lectors were once people from Khaenri'ah, possibly its aristocracy and knights.

The Art of Khemia is an advanced type of alchemy developed in Khaenri'ah which allows for the creation of life itself. Five hundred years ago, the Art of Khemia was a major contributing factor behind the cataclysm and the fall of Khaenri'ah.
The only known practitioners of the Art of Khemia are Rhinedottir and Albedo, her student and successful attempt to create a synthetic human.

Ruin Machines were made as weapons of war by the people of Khaenri'ah. The most common type, Ruin Guards, were code-named "Field Tillers" by the people of Khaenri'ah. After the nation's downfall, the machines migrated across Teyvat. Though they are dangerous, they now lack any planned purpose.

The people of Khaenri'ah, who were not "pure-blooded," were changed into creatures of the Abyss as a result of the curse, which took place after Celestia destroyed their kingdom. However, "pure-blooded" Khaenri'ahns were, instead, given the curse of immortality by Ronova, preventing them from aging, but still suffering from apparent erosion. The others, who hailed from the lands of the gods, were, instead, punished with the "curse of the wilderness" and transformed into various creatures; the majority of them turned into hilichurls, but others, rather, appeared to turn into Abyss Mages, Heralds, or Lectors. The royal guards of Khaenri'ah, The Black Serpents, were instead eroded into either Shadowy Husks or still remained as the Black Serpents, but with a different form and still sharing the fate of suffering from erosion.
However, the erosion was not complete, as some hilichurls were aware of the powers of a fountain in The Chasm and went there to "die" peacefully, while Halfdan and his subordinates remembered their duties to protect the people of Khaenri'ah.

People with a strong Khaenri'ahn bloodline can be easily identified by their eyes, which have a distinctive pupil in the shape of a four-point star (like a compass, in the directions of up, down, left, and right).
Kaeya's family, the Alberich Clan, were the Regents of Khaenri'ah after the cataclysm. It is unclear how many generations passed between Kaeya and the cataclysm; it is also unclear why Kaeya is unaffected by the curse.
Other persons associated with the state include Pierro, Capitano, Rhinedottir, and possibly Albedo and Arlecchino by extension.

Khaenri'an Culture
Agriculture
Khaenri'ah is dark underground and mostly barren of natural life. This led Khaenri'ahns to focus on artificial creation of life itself by developing the Art of Khemia.

Architecture
According to Dainsleif, the ruins in The Chasm: Underground Mines look somewhat similar to those of Khaenri'ah, and their civilization had ties to the one of Khaenri'ah.

The remnants of ancient Khaenri'ah like the Ruins of Dahri, giant Ruin Golems in Sumeru or an Azosite factory located in the Girdle of the Sands all share a grandiose scale. Furthermore, the Golems, the Azosite factory and the Madinat al-Nuhas testing facility share the same industrial, brass feel on the inside.

Education
Khaenri'ah possessed a Royal Library, to which nobles (no information about others) such as Chlothar had access. They were still forbidden from accessing the banned texts which the library held, among which were those that involved recipes that required the power and blessings from the Seven, as they were considered taboo.

Entertainment
The Universitas Magistrorum developed a minor spell called "Chaos Permeation" or "The Seven-Shifting Serpent" that was made to mock Vision holders on the surface by using Abyssal energy to evoke effects similar to the Elements. It was used as a party trick in performances and parades. Street performers spent months to master shifting a single element.

Technology
Khaenri'ahn technology before the cataclysm was advanced enough to allow production of automatons known as Ruin Machines, which were considered weapons of war. These machines could remain active for hundreds of years, mostly due in part to a self-repair system. They took on the forms of various wildlife on the surface and could even imitate some of their functions.

Khaenri'ahns used Azosite as a form of energy, drawn from pure elemental energy from Ley Lines, formed into Energy Blocks for use and produced in the factory located in the Girdle of the Sands. This workshop was the last in the entire kingdom to use an Azosite-powered system.
Khemia was also an advanced art, compared to widespread alchemy.

The four-pointed star (unofficial name), is a recurring astroid star. It is a recurring symbol on Khaenri'ah-adjacent characters' clothing and design. Notably, pure-blooded Khaenri'ahns have pupils that take the shape of a four-pointed star. The shape can be found on Albedo's neck between his collarbones. This symbol is also prominently used in association with the Traveler.

Eight-Pointed Star
This motif is a recurring symbol tied to Khaenri'ah, present on Chlothar's and Halfdan's clothes, The Black Serpents' armors and on Gate of Zulqarnain. The eight-pointed star shape also appears on or around the 'eyes' of Ruin Machines.

Languages
Little is known about Khaenri'ah's native language. Black Serpent Knights attempt to speak it while guarding hilichurls in the Chasm, but Dainsleif is only able to make out one word, "run." 
 With the influx of the immigrants, Khaenri'ah likely used the common language. It is also likely that the nation used a version of now-associated with the Abyss Latin-Based Language.

Politics
Before the cataclysm, Khaenri'ah had been a monarchy with a stratified society, by class and likely by nationality (native Khaenri'ahns contrasted with the immigrants). Around the time of the cataclysm, the political power of the Eclipse Dynasty waned, allowing the noble Alberich Clan to usurp power with Anfortas as the regent.
Following the gods' invasion of Khaenri'ah, the current leadership is unknown, but people still continue to live in the nation and struggle against the curse inflicted by them. Kaeya was intentionally abandoned in Mondstadt near the Dawn Winery for the sake of an "ancient plot".

7.content:
Normal Boss challenges contain enemies much stronger than Elite Enemies, but also provide better rewards for defeating them.  Most Normal Bosses are placed near a Teleport Waypoint, though some are further than others. Some Normal Bosses may require the player to progress to a certain point in a World Quest or complete a fairly simple puzzle in order to access them for the first time. Most Normal Bosses consist of a single main enemy, but a few fights consist of several enemies, such as the Coral Defenders and the Icewind Suite.

A Normal Boss is usually idle in the center of their arena and will not react to the player unless they get too close or attack it. Some bosses may not be present in the arena, instead having an environmental effect which requires the player to get close to it in order to trigger the fight. The lone exception is the Icewind Suite, which requires players to talk to Maillardet in order to initiate the fight.  Normal Bosses are more resistant to crowd control effects such as displacement, have significantly higher Interruption Resistance and are immune to freeze caused by Frozen, barring some mechanics that the Solitary Suanni uses.

Unlike Elite Enemies, once they have been defeated a Trounce Blossom will spawn in the area, and players can use Original Resin Original Resin ×40 to open them to claim their rewards.  Normal Boss enemies reward Adventure EXP Adventure EXP ×200 along with a certain amount of Mora Mora and Companionship EXP Companionship EXP. Each Normal Boss has a unique Character Level-Up Material, which is required to ascend characters. They also drop a small array of 3, 4 and 5-star artifacts, depending on the player's World Level.

After claiming rewards from the Trounce Blossom, the boss will respawn in roughly 5 minutes, to give the player some time to prepare if necessary. If the rewards from the blossom are not claimed, the boss will not respawn unless the player teleports out of the area.

All bosses drop artifacts from the Gladiator's Finale or Wanderer's Troupe sets.  Character Sheets for each will follow in separate installations.

Mondstadt Bosses

Bathysmal Vishap Herd - Inazuma

Sumeru Bosses

Electro Regisvine - Sumeru
