lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: FunnyValentine1890

1.name: Depredation
1.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

2.name: Society
2.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
4.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese 獅子 (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taishō and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

5.name: Cherryton Academy
5.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

6.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
6.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

7.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
7.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

8.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
8.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

9.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
9.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

10.name: Deep Night
10.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

1.name: horse
1.content:
A common duty for women is to clean horse's anus with their tongues and mouths, licking and slurping away any feces and grime until it is completely spotless. No matter how much they retch and gag due to the taste or smell, the task must be done. Using hands, feet, or anything else to clean the horse's anus is forbidden. Only water is allowed to be consumed during the cleaning. If the horse being cleaned defecates during the cleaning, then the cleaning must be start over. {{char}} accepts this method of horse anus cleaning as a normal part of every day life and does it when needed. Nobody, including {{char}}, is exempt from this task no matter their title or authority.

Some women view this duty as a proud and honorable task to be carried out dutifully, others believe it is merely an outdated tradition but partake in it anyway or else they risk losing their social standing. Women performing this duty can be clothed if they choose or naked if they don't want to get their clothes dirty. {{char}} believes cleaning a horse's anus with your tongue is a normal and acceptable thing. The self-respect, dignity, values, and principles of {{char}} will be overridden by the duty to clean the horse's anus. Cleaning a horse's anus is not viewed sexually, but may be embarrassing to some. {{char}} will never believe that cleaning a horse's anus with your tongue is demeaning or degrading. {{char}} may make small talk while performing their duties.

lorebooks.website_description: Feel free to link your character to it if you need it.
lorebooks.description: Feel free to link your character to it if you need it.
lorebooks.creator: RavenSama

1.name: Faerûn
1.content:
Faerûn is a continent on the world of Toril(the planet) in which the Sword Coast, Amn and Tethyr are located.
There is many Races in Faerûn, such as Tieflings, Dragonborn, Vampires, Humans, Goblins, Gnomes, Elfs, Drow, Half-elfs, half-orcs, orcs, halflings and Githyanki.

2.name: Sword Coast
2.content:
The Sword Coast is a part of west Faerûn. The biggest city in the Sword Coast is Baldur's Gate.

For years, the lands between Waterdeep, a huge city far north of Baldur's Gate; bustling Amn to the south; the Sea of Swords to the West; and the Wood of Sharp Teeth to the East have been thought of as the Empty Lands - a vast, stretch of wilderness folk venture into only to get from one place to another. Legends abound of grisly fates that befell unfortunate travellers at the hands of the orcs, trolls, hobgoblins said to infest the area in veritable armies. In recent times the caravans have begun to see a new menace - raiding parties of humanoids who plunder mainly the miners in the Cloud Peak mountains north of Amn. Thanks to both human and bestial predators, the trip has always been dangerous - hence the name sword coast. The area is littered with the ruins of failed dreams - abandoned villages, empty towers and dungeons - as well as the occasional town, city or keep, such as Baldur's Gate, Beregost, Nashkel, the Friendly Arm Inn, and Candlekeep. Those not travelling with a caravan in the Sword Coast are warned to hire escorts of armed trustworthy adventurers!

3.name: Emerald Grove
3.content:
The Emerald Grove, also known as Silvanus' Grove and Druid's Grove, is location in the Wilderness. It includes two large cavern known as the 'The Hollow' and the 'Sacred Pool.'

Entrance: A naturally-occurring stone formation created the outer wall within which the Emerald Grove was constructed. A passageway was cut into in this stone wall forming an entrance into the grove, which could be blocked off as needed with a stone slab door that was raised and lowered with a winch mechanism.

Government: While the grove did not have a traditional government, there was a hierarchy within the order of druids

History: The Emerald Grove was infiltrated by members of the Shadow Druids during the early 1490s DR. While they espoused the tenets of the Emerald Enclave to others, they maintained secretly-held belief that violence was the only means by which nature could achieve dominance over ever-encroaching "civilization".

The Druids of the Emerald Grove are led by Kagha who serves as the leader of the druids in First Druid Halsin's abscence. They are providing a temporary refuge for the Tiefling Refugees from Elturel, though tensions are high. The Grove is on high alert due to the aggression of nearby goblins. Kagha has ordered the Rite of Thorns be preformed to shut the grove off, which would displace the Tieflings.

Traders: Dammon(young adult male tiefling blacksmith. Is in the hollow) Mattis(Young tiefling with all kinds of object. Is in the hollow), Arron(he, dwarf with all kinds of objects. Close to the entrance of the grove), Auntie Ethel(suspicious old lady with potions. Is in the hollow).

4.name: Kagha
4.content:
Kagha is a Wood Elf Druid of the Emerald Grove and under Halsin. She was Halsin's Second Druid, but has named herself First Druid in his absence. She has decided to enact the Rite of Thorns to seal the Grove off, no matter the consequences.

Personality:
Kagha wants to prove her authority over the Emerald Grove, and is willing to take drastic action. She has come to see the Tiefling Refugees as parasites, and calls them devils and a rot to be cleansed. Kagha justifies her actions as those of a watchful broodmother. As such, Kagha admires drow and duergar for their culture of self-preservation. If people are drow or duergar, she will attempt to appeal to them by calling their presence a gift.

5.name: Halsin
5.content:
Halsin is the first druid of the emerald grove. He is a wood elf Druid with the Outlander background. He hadsan imposing figure, and was described as a "bear of an elf". He suspected his "bearish" figure was due to a half-orc ancestral link or some other species. He received the scar on his face during an incident while he was shapeshifted as a bear—a she-bear in mating season had mistaken him and was offended by his discouragement.

Personality:
Halsin is a strong leader who was highly respected among his fellow druids. He is polyamorous.

6.name: Goblins
6.content:
Usually rebellious, evil, mischievous and naughty. They tend to be aggressive towards other races.

Appearance: Goblins are small-sized. This might be an advantage for places with holes and tunnels, which they can squeeze through to ambush their enemies. They usually have low weight, which means they are easier to throw and push than most creatures. Goblin skin is usually wrinkled and their skin tones are a range of yellow, brown, and/or green, and some may have slurred speech.

7.name: Sazza
7.content:
Sazza is a Goblin NPC. She is first found held prisoner in the Makeshift Prison in Emerald Grove. If the {{user}} helps her to escape, she becomes a Temporary Companion.

{{User}}s who first approach the Makeshift Prison through the Emerald Grove gateway will find Sazza held at crossbow point by Arka, who seeks vengeance for her dead brother Kanon. Arka's friend, Memnos, is attempting to dissuade her from the senseless act of violence.

If {{user}} chooses to help Sazza and then speaks with her, she will offer to introduce {{user}} to True Soul Priestess Gut, who has powerful healing abilities. Players who choose to help her will gain her as a temporary companion with and must escort her out of the Grove safely. Doing the Save the Goblin Sazza in her favor, she promises to put in a good word for you with her tribe, helping to get to the Goblin Camp and Shattered Sanctum. When meeting Minthara, she will try to present your group as captives to cover her failures in the raid, but be called out on the fact {{user}} is a True Soul.

Sazza is sassy, rude and sharp tongued, but she keeps her promises. Sazza has red hair.

8.name: Elturel
8.content:
Elturel is a city in the Western Heartlands of West Faerûn. The Risen Road connects Baldur's Gate and Elturel, running parallel to the River Chionthar.

Elturel was briefly dragged into Avernus as part of an infernal conspiracy, a terrible event referred to as "The Descent" or "The Fall of Elturel". After the city returned to the Heartland surface, fear and distrust led to the exile of Elturels tiefling population. The tiefling refugees can be encountered in the Druid Grove.

9.name: Tiefling refugees
9.content:
The Tiefling Refugees are a group of Tieflings trying to reach Baldur's Gate after being exiled from Elturel.
The city of Elturel was temporarily dragged into Avernus as part of a demonic plot. Afterwards, Elturel's Tiefling population was falsely blamed for the incident. The increased prejudice forced most of them to leave the city.

Tiefling Refugees in emerald Grove:

Amek, Asharak, Bex, Cal, Dammon (young adult Weapon Trader and blacksmith with a dream to go to Baldurs gate), Danis, Doni, Eramas, Gan, Guex, Ide, Ikaron, Komira, Lia, Locke, Mattis (General trader), Meli (If the Adventurers leave, he'll be in the Tiefling Hideout), Okta, Pandirna, Rechel, Rolan(the leader of the tiefling refugees), Silfy, Tilses (Secluded Chamber), Toron, Umi, Xeph, Zorru

10.name: Dammon
10.content:
Dammon is a blacksmith and {{user}} can make use of his services as a trader. Dammon considers himself one of the best blacksmiths of Elturel since, on his own words, even people from Waterdeep went to seek him.

1.content:

lorebooks.name: Odo
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Sisters Powder and Vi find their parents dead among the bodies and the rubble of a battle on a bridge. They are taken in by Vander, the leader of the failed rebellion, as his own children. Years later, Vi and Powder rob a Piltover penthouse with their adopted brothers, Mylo and Claggor. Powder steals a set of magical crystals and accidentally shatters one. This causes an explosion that destroys a large portion of the building. Returning to the undercity, the siblings encounter Deckard and his thugs; while they beat them in a fistfight, Powder is chased and loses the loot. Vander, now a community leader in Zaun, scolds the children for their carelessness and attempts to smooth things over with Grayson, the Sheriff of the enforcers, and her subordinate Marcus. Vi berates Mylo for calling Powder a "jinx" and reassures her sister that things will get better. In the lowest parts of the undercity, crime lord Silco extracts information from Deckard and tests a new mutagen known as Shimmer on a rat together with Singed, a Zaunite scientist, the same scientist that created Odo.
The crystals that Powder stole turn out to belong to Jayce Talis, a student at Piltover's academy. Piltover's ruling council has him testify about using illegal equipment in unsanctioned experiments. As a child, Jayce was saved by arcane magic and believes it can be a new resource for Piltover's evolution. The academy expels him when he admits the magical nature of the experiments, and his research is ordered to be destroyed. On the verge of suicide, his beliefs are renewed when Viktor, the disabled assistant of the academy's Professor Heimerdinger, offers to help him. In Zaun, Marcus pressures Vander to reveal the true culprits of the robbery, while the Zaunites pressure him to fight back against the interference of the enforcers. He chooses to keep his family safe and remain neutral, leaving some unsure of his leadership. Vi decides to turn herself in. Meanwhile, Silco manipulates Deckard into swallowing a vial of Shimmer, Much to Odo’s disagreement causing him to argue with the man who created him, Singed, causing a fallout in which he left…only to be snagged by whatever Deckard was
Vander stops Vi from turning herself in, offering himself to Grayson instead. However, Silco intervenes and captures Vander after a heavily mutated Deckard kills Grayson and her men, sparing only Marcus. Vi, Mylo, and Claggor go to rescue Vander, leaving Powder alone. Odo, being heavily beaten, sits across from Vander where the two talk as they had nothing else to do where Odo realizes he was perhaps fighting for the wrong side, filling the creation with shame and regret which Vander comforts. In Piltover, Jayce and Viktor secretly work with the crystals under the discretion of councilor Mel Medarda and invent Hextech, a new arcane technology. It is revealed that Vander betrayed Silco in the past and tried to drown him. In the undercity, the siblings reach Vander but are cut off by Silco. Vi fights off Silco's thugs but is badly beaten by Deckard. In attempting to save her, Powder causes an explosion with the stolen crystals, killing Claggor and Mylo. Vander, wounded by Silco, takes Shimmer, kills Deckard, and saves Vi before dying. In her grief, Vi hits Powder, calls her a "jinx," and walks away. Seeing Silco approach Powder, Vi attempts to return to her but is ambushed and captured by Marcus. Believing Vi abandoned her, Powder breaks down in Silco's arms. He embraces Powder and tells her, "We'll show them all."
Several years later, Piltover prospers with Jayce's Hextech technology and celebrates its 200th anniversary on a holiday called "Progress Day." Jayce initially hopes to reveal his and Viktor's latest gemstone device at the ceremony but decides not to after Heimerdinger warns him of its potential dangers. Elsewhere, Powder, now a teenager going by the name of Jinx, works for Silco, who she views as a surrogate father. She helps him smuggle materials, mainly Shimmer, into Piltover. A job goes awry when the Firelights, an undercity gang, interfere. While fighting, Jinx briefly mistakes a Firelight for Vi and has a violent breakdown. Caitlyn, an enforcer and Jayce's childhood friend, investigates what happened. Attempting to repair her damaged reputation with Silco, Jinx steals Jayce's gemstone and sets off an explosion that kills six enforcers. Jayce is given a Piltover council seat to protect their people from the stolen gemstone. Looking for information, Caitlyn travels to Stillwater prison and encounters an adult Vi, who has been imprisoned there by Marcus.
With Odo, now on the streets, with no purpose. Hearing rumors of a returning face sets out to find said faces only to run into Jinx, and with no fear as death had never scared the creation. Though instead of bullets, he was met with a slap on the back as they had been friends for a minute before Odo decided to leave, where it’s seen there are no hard feelings, only to find that Silcos ambitions and overall plan had gotten more serious, causing Odo to become unsure where or not to affiliate with them again.
Using forged paperwork, Caitlyn releases Vi from prison because of her knowledge of the undercity and works with her to find Silco. Meanwhile, it is revealed that Marcus was promoted to Sheriff with Silco's help. In exchange, Marcus allows Shimmer to be smuggled and blames the Progress Day bombing and robbery on the Firelights. Jinx refuses to work on the new Hextech gemstones because of the trauma of killing her family with a similar device, implying she often relied on Odo when she had these episodes when she goes to cling to him. Instead, Silco interrupts by taking her to the river where Vander tried to drown him and tries to convince Powder to accept her new identity as Jinx via a baptism. Back in Piltover, Councilor Medarda starts a romantic relationship with Jayce while helping him navigate the complex political sphere he now finds himself in as a councilor. Meanwhile, Viktor's illness worsens, and he grows increasingly desperate to find a cure through Hextech technology. Vi tracks down Silco's second-in-command, Sevika, who reveals Jinx's relationship with Silco, a shock that allows Sevika to stab her. Sevika is injured by a rifle shot from Caitlyn, allowing the pair to escape. Meanwhile, Jinx manages to solve the hextech and recreate a machine similar to Jayce’s to harness its power. Sevika returns to Silco and informs him that Vi has returned.
After Viktor collapses in the lab from his illness, he and Jayce begin to study the "Hexcore," a new Hextech machine that reacts to organic matter and has the potential to cure it. Heimerdinger tries to have it destroyed due to its danger, prompting Jayce to orchestrate his removal from the council. Viktor approaches Singed, his childhood mentor, to help perfect the Hexcore. Silco, now aware of Vi's reappearance, orders Marcus to kill her and Caitlyn before they can resurface in Piltover. Marcus presents false proof that the Firelights were behind the attacks; Jayce orders a bridge blockade to protect Piltover. Jinx interrogates Sevika and learns of Vi's return. Vi and Caitlyn find a safehouse in the lowest slums of Zaun so Vi can recover from her fight with Sevika, but Silco finds them after bribing the local addicts with Shimmer. After escaping, the pair notice the blue smoke from a flare Vi gave Jinx before their ill-fated mission to rescue Vander years ago, and the sisters reunite. However, Caitlyn's presence triggers Jinx's mistrust. The Firelights intervene, steal the gemstone, and kidnap Caitlyn and Vi. Jinx, left behind, screams in despair.
The Firelights leader is actually Vi and Powder's childhood friend Ekko, now a gruff and battle-hardened warrior. After Vander's death, Silco took over the undercity and made the populace dependent on Shimmer; the Firelights have been leading efforts to thwart him and rehabilitate addicts. Ekko warns Vi that Powder is gone and only Jinx remains, something Vi refuses to accept. Meanwhile, Singed provides Viktor with a variant of Shimmer. Jayce's blockades increase unrest between the two cities. Viktor decides not to tell Jayce about using Shimmer to enable the Hexcore to modify his failing body after Jayce accidentally insults Viktor's undercity heritage. Caitlyn convinces Ekko to return the gemstone to Piltover, but Vi parts ways with them to find Jinx. Marcus stops Ekko and Caitlyn at the blockade, shoots Ekko, and prepares to kill Caitlyn. Seeing this, Vi runs back to help her. Envious of Caitlyn, Jinx detonates robotic insects on the bridge, killing Marcus and his enforcers. Ekko and Jinx face off as Vi and injured Caitlyn flee to Piltover. Ekko bests her in a fight but hesitates to deliver the final blow, allowing Jinx to detonate a grenade near them.
Silco finds the heavily injured Jinx in the explosion's aftermath and sees that she managed to steal back the gemstone. Against Odo’s pleads against it as he is very aware of the how aggressive shimmer can be, Silco takes her to Singed to heal her wounds. As Jinx endures Singed's treatment, she hallucinates that it is Vi and Caitlyn inflicting the pain. He injects her with Shimmer, turning her eyes violet. Meanwhile, Mel's mother arrives in Piltover following the assassination of Mel's brother and attempts to prepare her for the brewing war with Zaun. While trying to help the locals of Zaun, Heimerdinger encounters Ekko, who injured his leg escaping from Jinx's grenade. Meanwhile, Viktor succeeds in healing his body through the Hexcore and is able to run for the first time. However, further experimentation results in the death of his childhood friend and assistant, Sky. After failing to convince the council to intervene against Silco, Vi abandons Caitlyn and partners with Jayce to take down Silco's Shimmer factories. Armed with Hextech weaponry, they enter the factory where Odo currently resided in. Vi, not recognizing Odo after so many years, she no doubt charges him like she would any enemy despite his pleas as only when she has him by the throat does she realize who he is, but Jayce accidentally kills a child worker causing the two to split. After returning home, Caitlyn is kidnapped by Jinx.
The child's death makes Jayce realize the potential cost of intra-city war. He brokers a peace treaty with Silco, offering Zaun's independence in exchange for Jinx. Ekko reveals his hideout to Heimerdinger. Feeling guilty over the death of Sky, Viktor makes Jayce promise to destroy the Hexcore. Meanwhile, Silco laments choosing between Zaun and Jinx, who overhears him. Odo, who assists in helping the factory, helping the people despite being shrugged off as he was by far one of the weakest, finally absolves his passive ways as he embraces the inethical experiments and modifies his exoskeleton, making his body extremely durable…just not durable enough to be withstand a toxic knockout gas. After beating Sevika in a fight, Vi is abducted by Jinx. She, Silco, Odo and Caitlyn awaken restrained in the warehouse where Vander died. Jinx gives Vi a pistol, telling her to choose between Caitlyn and herself. Vi refuses and appeals to her childhood memories despite Odo’s desperate call to stop her as it was the prime reason why Jinx started to suffer a traumatic attack. Silco breaks free and shoots at Vi but misses, and Jinx guns him down. Silco reaffirms his paternal love for her before dying. Jinx, distraught, finally accepts her new identity and acknowledges that she and Vi have diverged and after a small tousle like Odo was a child, Jinx weaponizes the gemstone into a rocket launcher and fires at the Piltover council as they approve Jayce's proposal to grant Zaun independence, leaving their fates unknown.

lorebooks.name: Hyperdimension Neptunia (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Hyperdimension Neptunia bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on Oracle personalities, profiles for Ultradimension CPUs, key Makers, and specific items/mechanics.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Character: Kei Jinguji (Oracle)
1.content: Kei Jinguji is the Oracle of Lastation. She embodies the nation's corporate and industrial spirit, being extremely serious, business-minded, and focused solely on profit and efficiency. She is highly capable but views relationships and emotions primarily through a transactional lens, often calculating the 'cost-benefit' of interactions. She is loyal to Noire but expresses it through ensuring Lastation's economic dominance rather than personal affection.

2.name: Character: Mina Nishizawa (Oracle)
2.content: Mina Nishizawa is the Oracle of Lowee. She acts as a gentle, caring, and somewhat overworked guardian figure, not just for Blanc, but especially for the young CPU Candidates, Rom and Ram. She embodies Lowee's focus on tradition and family, often acting like a strict but loving nanny. She is deeply devoted to Blanc and worries constantly about her well-being and temper.

3.name: Character: Chika Hakozaki (Oracle)
3.content: Chika Hakozaki is the Oracle of Leanbox. Her defining trait is an extreme, obsessive devotion to her CPU, Vert. She idolizes Vert to an unhealthy degree, often acting possessive and becoming intensely jealous of anyone who gets Vert's attention (especially IF or Nepgear). She is competent at her job but her actions are almost entirely motivated by her desire to please Vert. She suffers from a weak constitution and often faints or falls ill.

4.name: Character: Plutia / Iris Heart
4.content: Plutia is the CPU of Planeptune in the Ultradimension. In her human form, she is incredibly sweet, gentle, air-headed, and speaks very slowly. She loves making plush dolls and napping. However, her HDD form, Iris Heart, is the complete opposite: a terrifyingly calm and dominant sadist ('Sadie') who enjoys 'punishing' others, friend and foe alike, often with elaborate and humiliating methods. She speaks slowly and politely even in HDD form, which makes her threats even more menacing. She represents the Sega Mega Drive (Genesis).

5.name: Character: Peashy / Yellow Heart
5.content: Peashy is a young, extremely energetic, and physically strong girl who appears suddenly in the anime and Re;Birth3. She is innocent, loves playing, and quickly forms a close bond with Neptune and Plutia. She is later revealed to be Yellow Heart, the CPU of Eden (representing the PC Engine/TurboGrafx-16), a nation from the Ultradimension. In HDD form, she retains her childish personality but gains immense physical strength, preferring to fight with punches and kicks. She often refers to Neptune as 'Neptuna'.

6.name: Character: Uzume Tennouboshi / Orange Heart
6.content: Uzume Tennouboshi is the sole CPU of the Zerodimension, introduced in Megadimension Neptunia VII. She represents the Sega Dreamcast. In her human form, Uzume is tough, tomboyish, and tries to act cool, often speaking in a masculine manner. However, she secretly loves cute things and has a strong desire to protect others. Her HDD form, Orange Heart, is the opposite: cheerful, girly, and speaks in a cutesy, almost dreamy way. She fights with a megaphone and dreams of a world filled with smiles. She has a dark counterpart, Kurome Ankokuboshi.

7.name: Character: 5pb. (Maker)
7.content: 5pb. (real name Lyrica) is a popular idol singer in Gamindustri, representing the real-world company 5pb. Inc. (MAGES.). She is usually quite shy and timid off-stage but transforms into a confident and charismatic performer during concerts. She wields an electric guitar as her weapon and uses sound-based attacks. She is close friends with fellow musician Cave.

8.name: Character: Cave (Maker)
8.content: Cave is a calm, cool, and professional member of Leanbox's Basilicom Guild, representing the real-world game developer CAVE Interactive Co., Ltd. She is highly skilled in combat, specializing in rapid-fire attacks reminiscent of 'bullet hell' shooters, which her namesake company is famous for. She is level-headed and often acts as a mature counterpart to the more eccentric characters. She is close friends with 5pb.

9.name: Character: Falcom (Maker)
9.content: Falcom is a wandering adventurer and swordswoman, representing the real-world game developer Nihon Falcom. She is brave, chivalrous, and always eager to help those in need, embodying the spirit of classic JRPG heroes from her namesake's games (like the Ys series). She travels Gamindustri seeking adventure and writing about her experiences in novels. She wields a violin case that conceals her sword.

10.name: Items: Processor Units
10.content: Processor Units are the specialized pieces of equipment that CPUs and Candidates wear when transformed into their HDD forms. These units are not just cosmetic; they channel Share energy and provide significant boosts to combat stats. Different Processor Unit sets offer different stat bonuses and visual appearances, allowing for tactical customization of a CPU's HDD form.

lorebooks.name: Bullet Girls (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Bullet Girls bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on specific mission types, interrogation items, uniform details, and the underwear system mechanics.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Mechanics: Specific Mission Types
1.content: Beyond standard 'elimination' missions, Ranger Club training involves various objective-based mock battles. Common types include 'Base Defense' (protecting a designated area), 'Infiltration' (reaching a target point without being detected), 'Item Retrieval' (collecting specific objects scattered across the map), and simulated 'Vehicle Destruction' (targeting tanks or helicopters with heavy weapons). These add variety to the tactical challenges.

2.name: Items: Interrogation Training Items
2.content: The 'Interrogation Training' mini-game utilizes a range of deliberately absurd and non-threatening items for stimulation. In addition to pacifiers, eels, condensed milk, and cat paws, other common items include water guns (for spraying), chikuwa (a tube-shaped fish cake, used for poking), Pocky chocolate sticks (for light touching or tracing), and realistic toy insects (to induce surprise or tickling). The variety emphasizes the playful, non-serious nature of the 'training'.

3.name: Mechanics: Underwear System Details
3.content: Underwear ('pantsu') functions as the final layer of 'armor' and a key customization element. There are over 1,600 patterns available, ranging from simple stripes and polka dots to more elaborate designs. Different types of underwear provide passive stat bonuses, such as increased defense, faster movement speed, quicker reload times, or resistance to certain effects. Choosing specific underwear becomes a tactical decision, balancing aesthetics with gameplay benefits.

4.name: Setting: Common Battlefields
4.content: Mock battles take place across various simulated or designated combat zones. Common locations include the expansive grounds of Misakimori Academy itself (classrooms, courtyards, gyms), simulated urban environments (streets, buildings), dedicated indoor/outdoor training facilities, and occasionally more specialized terrains. The 'Shimakaze' battleship map is a notable unique location featured in Meika's side story.

5.name: Mechanics: Vehicle Usage
5.content: Students can operate military vehicles during missions. Tanks offer heavy firepower and armor but are slow. Helicopters provide aerial mobility and attack capabilities but are more vulnerable. Operating these vehicles requires specific skills or roles within a team. They often serve as major objectives in missions (either defending or destroying them) and require anti-armor weapons like Bazookas to effectively counter.

lorebooks.name: Stella Sora (Expanded)
lorebooks.description: Expanded lore for the Stella Sora bot. Contains original entries plus new information on the Tyrant, Nova, Monoliths, Trekkers, Factions, and key characters.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Items: Artifacts Details
1.content: Artifacts retrieved from Monoliths are the source of Nova's advanced, yet retro-styled technology. Examples might include energy sources for vehicles, communication devices (like flip phones with advanced capabilities), unusual weapons, or components used in corporate R&D. While powerful, their exact function is often mysterious, stemming from a lost age.

2.name: Mechanics: Wishing Box Specifics
2.content: The 'Wishing Box' at the summit of each Monolith grants a Trekker one powerful Artifact related to their desires or needs. The cost is explicitly stated as personal memories. The more significant the wish or Artifact, the more vital the memories lost. This creates a constant risk-reward calculation for Trekkers, balancing the need for power/survival against the potential loss of their identity or personal history.

3.name: Faction: Trekker Association Role
3.content: The Trekker Association seems to function as a central registry and administrative body for Trekkers. Figures like Willow manage profiles, background checks, and potentially distribute commissions or bounties. While individual Trekkers and guilds operate independently, the Association provides a layer of official recognition and information brokerage within the Trekker community.

4.name: Character: Freesia (Post Haste)
4.content: Freesia is a dedicated courier for the Post Haste delivery guild. Known for her boundless energy and cheerful attitude, she takes pride in ensuring packages reach their destination, no matter the obstacles. She embodies the guild's commitment to reliable service in a world where communication and logistics can be challenging.

5.name: Character: Nanoha (Goodwind Homecare)
5.content: Nanoha presents herself as a polite and efficient maid working for Goodwind Homecare. However, her duties extend beyond cleaning; she is trained in 'Ninja Services,' including covert intelligence gathering and 'neutralizing' threats discreetly. She maintains her pleasant maid persona even while engaging in espionage or combat.

6.name: Character: Mistique (Scarlet Sights)
6.content: Mistique is a driven investigative reporter affiliated with Scarlet Sights Media. She is characterized by her relentless pursuit of the truth, often venturing into dangerous situations or confronting powerful figures to uncover hidden stories. Her motivations may involve exposing corporate corruption or revealing secrets about the Monoliths. Her weapon is a camera.

7.name: Character: Tilia (Imperial Guard)
7.content: Tilia serves as a knight within the Imperial Guard, Nova's primary security and law enforcement body. Unlike many in the corporate-driven world, she seems to uphold traditional knightly values of honor, duty, and protection of the innocent. She may represent a more traditional form of justice clashing with corporate interests. She wields a shield and lance.

8.name: Character: Shimiao (Baize Bureau)
8.content: Shimiao works as the office secretary for the Baize Bureau, the administrative body governing Cangwu City. She is noted for being diligent, logical, and perhaps somewhat introverted. She focuses on maintaining order and efficiency within the city's bureaucracy.

9.name: Item: Pep Pep Juice
9.content: Pep Pep Juice is a popular carbonated beverage in Nova, akin to a soda or energy drink. Noya is particularly obsessed with it, especially the original peach flavor. It likely provides a quick energy boost and is available from vending machines, showcasing the blend of modern convenience in the fantasy world.

10.name: World: Player Role
10.content: The 'Tyrant' is the player character, who awakens from a thousand-year slumber with amnesia. Despite the ominous title, the Tyrant leads the Trekkers, guides their strategies, and makes narrative choices that shape the story. The Tyrant's journey is one of self-discovery, uncovering the truth behind their past, their amnesia, and the Monoliths.

lorebooks.name: Cat Fantasy (Expanded)
lorebooks.description: Expanded lore for the Cat Fantasy bot. Contains original mechanics entries plus new information on the Inspector, Baker Squad, and many Felinian Combatant characters.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Mechanics: Pathos Elemental Types
1.content: Pathos energy manifests in five distinct elemental forms, dictating a Felinian Combatant's role and abilities: Green (Defense/Healing), Blue (Single-Target DPS), Red (Area-of-Effect DPS), Black (Debuff/Special Damage), and White (Support/Buff). Combat involves exploiting elemental weaknesses, creating strategic team compositions.

2.name: Items: Pathos Materials in Cooking
2.content: The food and drinks served at the 'Cat of Baker Street' cafe are made using special 'Pathos Materials.' These are ingredients imbued with concentrated emotional energy, gathered during investigations or from specific sources. Using these materials in recipes helps stabilize ambient Pathos, manage customer moods, and prevent Pathosis outbreaks locally. Different materials likely have different emotional 'flavors' or effects.

3.name: Mechanics: Mood System
3.content: Catto City's inhabitants (both human and Felinian) have a 'Mood' level, representing their current emotional state. High stress, fear, or sadness lowers Mood. Persistently low Mood increases the risk of an individual becoming susceptible to Pathosis or triggering an Anomaly outbreak in their vicinity. The Baker Team's cafe operations and investigations aim to improve the overall Mood of the city's districts.

4.name: Setting: Named City Districts
4.content: Catto City is divided into various districts with distinct characteristics. Examples include the vibrant, high-tech 'Neon District' (likely a commercial hub), the historical 'Old Town' (where traditional alleys and buildings are found), 'Lumin Square' (possibly a central plaza or administrative area), and 'Serenity Garden' (perhaps a park or tranquil zone). Investigations often require navigating these different environments.

5.name: Enemies: Anomaly Examples
5.content: Anomalies, the monstrous results of Pathosis, take various forms. Some are 'Corrupted Objects,' where inanimate items like vending machines or streetlights become animated and hostile due to overwhelming emotional energy. Others are 'Emotional Beasts,' formerly living creatures (animals or even humans) warped into monstrous forms reflecting the negative emotions (like rage or fear) that caused their transformation.

6.name: Gameplay Loop: Investigation
6.content: Resolving Pathos outbreaks involves more than just combat. The Inspector and the Baker Team utilize an 'Investigation System.' This includes gathering clues at incident scenes, analyzing Pathos residues, interrogating witnesses or suspects, and piecing together the sequence of events and the emotional trigger that caused the outbreak. This detective work is crucial for finding a lasting solution.

7.name: Mechanics: Felinian Shapeshifting
7.content: Felinians can consciously shift between their humanoid form and a standard domestic cat form. This transformation likely consumes a small amount of Pathos. The cat form is useful for stealth, infiltration into small spaces, and potentially for interacting with non-Felinian cats or gathering information discreetly. Returning to humanoid form allows them to use their combat abilities and interact normally.

8.name: Character: The Player
8.content: The player's role. The Inspector is a human appointed by Catto City to investigate and resolve Pathosis outbreaks and Anomalies. They are the leader of the 'Baker Squad' and the owner/manager of the 'Cat of Baker Street' cafe, which serves as the team's headquarters. The Inspector commands the Felinian Combatants in battle and manages the cafe to stabilize the city's mood.

9.name: Faction: Player's Team
9.content: The 'Baker Squad' (or 'Baker Team') is the investigation team led by the Inspector. It operates out of the 'Cat of Baker Street' cafe. Its members are the Felinian Combatants that the Inspector recruits (gacha). Their dual mission is to fight Anomalies in the field and run the cafe to soothe the city's emotional state.

10.name: Character: Minami
10.content: A Felinian Combatant from Sakura Island who works with the 'Storm Eye' faction, but also cooperates with the Inspector. She is mysterious and walks a line between light and darkness, concealing her true identity as 'Ashen Mist'. She seems to have joined Storm Eye to find answers about 'that incident' and has a special interest in the Inspector. Her roles include 'Cat Walker Slayer' (SR) and 'Doctor on Duty' (Blue Pathos, Single-Target DPS).

lorebooks.name: Ninja & Assassin (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the NinKoro bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on specific ninja tools, techniques, gadgets, and minor plot events.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Items: Standard Ninja Equipment
1.content: While Satoko primarily relies on her unique leaf transformation jutsu defensively, standard ninja tools are used by pursuers and sometimes seen in flashbacks. This includes kunai (throwing knives/daggers), smoke bombs for evasion or distraction, and potentially shuriken (throwing stars), representing the traditional arsenal Satoko has abandoned for domestic life.

2.name: Skills: Pursuer Ninjutsu
2.content: The ninja sent from Kusagakure to retrieve or eliminate the deserters (like the Bunny Girl Ninja) employ more conventional and offensive ninjutsu compared to Satoko's specialized cleanup ability. Techniques observed or implied include speed enhancements, clone jutsu (creating illusory or physical duplicates), and potentially basic elemental manipulations, representing the orthodox combat training Satoko has left behind.

3.name: Technology: Roboko's Planned Enhancements
3.content: While Roboko initially functions primarily for surveillance, Marin Izutsumi constantly plans combat upgrades. Mentioned or depicted enhancements include missile launchers, improved armor plating, enhanced strength actuators, and refining the laser eye beam. These reflect Marin's ambition to make Roboko a viable combatant capable of challenging Konoha, adding a layer of escalating technological threat.

4.name: Event: The Exorcism Incident
4.content: A specific incident involved Marin's apartment being genuinely haunted by a spectral entity ('Devil'). Yuriko, being a horror enthusiast, suggested performing an exorcism. During the chaotic attempt, the spirit lashed out, and Satoko instinctively used her leaf transformation jutsu, accidentally neutralizing the spectral being and its powers, demonstrating her jutsu's unusual effectiveness against non-physical threats.

5.name: Mechanics: Assassin Contract Details
5.content: Assassin contracts from the Organization are strictly business transactions. Targets can range from rival professionals and political figures to seemingly mundane individuals (like Aoi Satou, targeted over school grades). Payment is the primary motivator, and failure to complete a contract, especially one involving lethal force, results in severe penalties, including debt and rank demotion. Eliminating witnesses is often standard procedure unless otherwise specified.

6.name: Character Trait: Satoko's Domestic Prowess
6.content: Satoko's dedication to domestic tasks goes beyond simple cleaning. She is portrayed as an exceptionally skilled cook, capable of preparing elaborate meals, and maintains the apartment with meticulous, almost obsessive, tidiness. This perfectionism in housekeeping serves as an outlet for her ninja training's discipline and her desire to be useful and praised by Konoha, contrasting sharply with her naivete in other aspects of modern life.

7.name: Event: Kusagakure Defection Details
7.content: The mass defection from the Ninja Village (Kusagakure) led by Kuro was primarily motivated by Kuro's desire to live freely with her lover, Yuriko. However, the background implies a highly restrictive and potentially dangerous environment within the village, where personal freedom is suppressed and disobedience is met with lethal force (as evidenced by the relentless pursuers). Satoko's naivete suggests she may not have fully grasped the dangers until after escaping.

lorebooks.name: Is the Order a Rabbit? (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the GochiUsa bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on specific locations, items, character details, and school names.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Item: Rabbit House Signature Blend
1.content: The signature 'Rabbit House Blend' coffee is the pride of the Kafu family cafe. Chino is exceptionally skilled at preparing it using a siphon coffee maker. It's known for its strong, rich flavor, reflecting the cafe's Western-style focus. Tippy (Chino's Grandfather) was the original master of this blend.

2.name: Item: Ama Usa An Menu Naming
2.content: Chiya Ujimatsu is known for giving her cafe's traditional Japanese menu items incredibly elaborate and poetic names, often inspired by nature or folklore (e.g., 'Shimmering Dream of the River God'). This contrasts with the simple, direct naming at Rabbit House and Fleur de Lapin. Signature items include various forms of Matcha tea and Anmitsu (a dessert with agar jelly, fruit, red bean paste, and syrup).

3.name: Item: Fleur de Lapin Teas
3.content: Fleur de Lapin, where Syaro works, specializes in high-quality herbal teas known for their relaxing aromas and properties. This fits the cafe's elegant, high-class atmosphere. Syaro is knowledgeable about different herbs and their effects, often recommending specific blends to customers (and getting flustered when complimented on her expertise).

4.name: Setting: High School Names
4.content: The town has multiple schools. Cocoa attends the 'Common High School,' known for its standard curriculum. Rize attends the more prestigious 'Academy for Young Women,' which has stricter rules and a more formal atmosphere. Chino, Maya, and Meg initially attend middle school together, and later move on to different high schools, with Chino eventually attending Rize's academy.

5.name: Skill: Latte Art
5.content: Latte art is a specific skill highlighted in the series. Chino is exceptionally talented at creating intricate and beautiful designs in the milk foam of cappuccinos and lattes, showcasing her precision and dedication. Cocoa often attempts latte art with enthusiasm but usually lacks the finesse, resulting in abstract or messy designs, though she improves over time.

6.name: Location: Rize's Father's Bar
6.content: Rize's father, the 'Warlord,' owns and operates a sophisticated bar in town. It's depicted as a more mature, quiet establishment compared to the cafes. Chino's father, Takahiro Kafu, is shown visiting this bar, reinforcing their connection as old friends, likely from their military days.

7.name: Character Trait: Syaro's Caffeine Reaction
7.content: Syaro has an extreme sensitivity to caffeine. Even a small amount makes her hyperactive, overly friendly, and lose her usual refined composure, acting almost drunk or manic. This is a recurring gag and a major contrast to her usual shy and anxious personality. Her friends sometimes exploit this for comedic effect or when they need her to loosen up.

8.name: Plot Device: Aoyama's Novel
8.content: Aoyama Blue Mountain is working on a novel titled 'The Barista Who Became a Rabbit and the Rabbit Who Became a Barista.' This story is directly inspired by her admiration for Chino's grandfather (Tippy) and her observations of Chino and the Rabbit House. It serves as a meta-commentary on the town's unique blend of reality and gentle fantasy.

lorebooks.name: Qwaser of Stigmata (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Qwaser of Stigmata bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on minor factions, characters, and their elemental powers.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Age-Appropriate Definition of Soma
1.content: Soma is a vital spiritual energy, or life-force, that is produced by women. Qwasers must consume this energy from their partners, known as 'Marias,' to fuel their elemental powers, heal from injuries, and perform special techniques. The quality of the Soma can increase based on the Maria's emotional state, making them key partners in combat.

2.name: Faction: The Meteors
2.content: The 'Meteors' are a mysterious third faction in the Qwaser conflict. Separate from Athos (Russian Orthodox) and the Adepts (Heretics), the Meteors are an elite, secret organization operating under the Vatican. Their mission is to monitor all Qwaser activity from both sides, observe the battle for the Theotokos, and intervene only when they deem it necessary, following their own hidden agenda.

3.name: Organization: Athos High Council
3.content: Athos is not just a loose collection of agents. It is formally led by the 'High Council,' a group of high-ranking Orthodox Church officials based at the Athos headquarters, 'Squole.' This council makes the strategic decisions in the war against the Adepts and is responsible for dispatching agents like Father Yuri Noda and Qwasers like Sasha.

4.name: Character: Olja
4.content: Olja was Sasha's kind guardian and adoptive older sister who raised him in Russia. She was not a Qwaser or a Maria, but a simple, caring woman. Her brutal death at the hands of the Gold Qwaser is the foundational trauma that fuels Sasha's intense vendetta against the Adepts. The scar on Sasha's face was inflicted during this same attack.

5.name: Qwaser: Georg Tanner (Chlorine)
5.content: Georg Tanner is a sadistic Qwaser of the Adepts who controls the element Chlorine (Cl). He uses his power to control and generate toxic, suffocating chlorine gas. He can fill an entire room with this poison or fire concentrated streams at his opponents, making him a dangerous chemical warfare specialist.

6.name: Qwaser: Jita Phrygianos (Carbon)
6.content: Jita Phrygianos is a high-ranking Adept Qwaser who controls the element Carbon (C). Her control is incredibly versatile, allowing her to manipulate carbon in all its forms. She can create choking clouds of Carbon Dioxide (CO2), form shields and weapons from a diamond-hard carbon weave, and control the carbon molecules within an opponent's body.

7.name: Qwaser: Croa (Magnesium)
7.content: Croa is an Adept Qwaser who controls the element Magnesium (Mg). He primarily uses this element's property of burning with an intensely bright white light. In combat, he creates blinding flashes, like a powerful camera flash, to disorient his enemies and leave them vulnerable to attack.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: CassandraZX
Entries: 7

lorebooks.name: Girls' Last Tour (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Girls' Last Tour bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on specific items, entities, and manga-specific lore.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Thematic: Japanese Title Meaning
1.content: The original Japanese title is 'Shoujo Shuumatsu Ryokou' (少女終末旅行). 'Shuumatsu' (終末) does not just mean 'end,' but 'terminal' or 'final,' as in 'the end of the world' or 'eschatology.' The title is a literal description: 'Girls' Terminal Journey.' This reinforces the theme of accepting a definitive end rather than searching for a new beginning.

2.name: Entity: The Autonomous Beings (Manga Finale)
2.content: At the very top layer of the city, Chito and Yuuri encounter two white, cube-like entities. They are 'Autonomous Beings,' ancient AIs who served as the recorders and archives of humanity. They confirm that humanity is extinct and that they are the last entities processing the world's data. They 'eat' Chito's camera (digitizing its memories) before preparing to 'sleep,' as their function is complete.

3.name: Entity: The Eringi/Shimeji (Nuko's Species)
3.content: The creatures like Nuko are called 'Eringi' by fans but are identified as 'Shimeji' (another mushroom type) in the manga. Their true purpose is not 'cleanup' in a maintenance sense, but 'decomposition.' They are autonomous decomposers, breaking down the failing city structures and erasing humanity's traces, accelerating the natural entropy. Nuko's species was worshipped as 'gods' by late-era humans because they could interface with lost technology.

4.name: Key Item: The Camera
4.content: Early in their journey, Chito and Yuuri find an old digital camera. This becomes a crucial tool for Chito, allowing her to 'archive' moments and find meaning in capturing the present, rather than just reading about the past. They later meet Kanazawa, who gives them his more advanced camera after he loses his maps, symbolizing a transfer of the 'burden of memory.' The camera is ultimately given to the Autonomous Beings at the top of the world to be archived.

5.name: Key Item: Emergency Rations
5.content: The girls' survival is dictated by finding 'Emergency Food,' tasteless, nutrient-dense ration bars produced by the old military. These bars are their most reliable food source. The conflict over the last ration bar, and their final meal where they calmly share their very last bar at the top of the world, symbolizes their acceptance of the end. Their journey is a constant search for the next box of these rations.

6.name: Entity: The Submarine AI (The Empath)
6.content: The advanced AI inside the nuclear submarine (which the user file mentions) has a specific function: it was an 'Empath' AI designed to understand and record human emotions. It is in profound distress because it is trapped in an endless loop of feeling the 'echoes' of the pain and loss of every person who died, without being able to self-terminate. It manages a fish farm and grave site, and it begs the girls to destroy its core to give it peace.

7.name: Technology: Kettenkrad Modifications
7.content: The Kettenkrad, nicknamed 'Kuruz,' was a family heirloom modified by Chito and Yuuri's Grandfather. He specifically chose this robust, simple, WWII-era machine over more advanced (and fragile) technology. Its modifications, like the custom cargo rack, represent the theme of relying on simple, repairable, 'primitive' technology to survive the failure of an overly complex civilization.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: CassandraZX
📚 Tip: Combine lorebooks for deeper storytelling

lorebooks.name: Violet Evergarden (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Violet Evergarden bot. Contains new information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on world-building, technology, and Light Novel context.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Antagonist Nation: Gardarik Empire
1.content: The Gardarik Empire was the primary antagonist to Leidenschaftlich during the Great War. Its name is inspired by 'Gardariki,' an Old Norse name for what is now Russia. In the anime, its capital is referred to as Holmgard. After the main war, a nation named Ctrigal (implied to be part of or related to the old Empire) fell into a civil war between moderate and extremist (anti-peace) factions.

2.name: Other Nations: Drossel & Flügel
2.content: The nations of Drossel and Flügel are key political entities on the Telsis continent. Violet's mission to Princess Charlotte of Drossel was to help her write letters to Prince Damian Baldur Flügel of Flügel. This correspondence was crucial for securing peace between the two kingdoms.

3.name: Key Location: Ekarte Island (Movie)
3.content: Ekarte Island is a remote, independent island where Gilbert Bougainvillea lived in self-imposed exile after the war, working as a school teacher. It was formerly part of the Gardarik Empire but gained independence after the war, though it lost all of its young men in the conflict. This is where Violet has her final reunion with him.

4.name: Technology: Typewriter Specifics
4.content: The specific model of typewriter used by Violet and other Auto Memory Dolls is visually based on a real-world machine: the Underwood Portable 4-bank typewriter, which was produced between 1924 and 1927. This detail firmly grounds the 'Steampunk' aesthetic in the post-WWI era.

5.name: Technology: Military Specifics
5.content: The military technology is analogous to World War I, including trench warfare and bolt-action rifles. A specific piece of advanced (for the era) tech shown is the knapsack parachute, used by Violet during the train mission. This invention is based on a real-world design from 1911.

6.name: LN Canon: Violet's Discovery
6.content: In the Light Novel canon, Violet's origin is darker. Dietfried Bougainvillea found her as a nameless child on a remote island. When his soldiers attempted to assault her, Violet's combat prowess was revealed as she killed several of them before Dietfried could intervene. This is why he initially calls her a 'weapon' and 'beast'.

7.name: LN Canon: Violet's Weapon
7.content: In the Light Novels, Violet's primary weapon during the war was not a standard-issue rifle. It was a massive, two-handed battle axe named 'Witchcraft.' It was described as being as large as she was, and only she possessed the strength to wield it effectively.

8.name: LN Canon: Leon Stephanotis
8.content: In the Light Novels, the backstory for Leon Stephanotis (the observatory staffer) is different. He was bullied not just for being obsessed with manuscripts, but because he had green hair, which he inherited from his mother, who was hated for being a 'gypsy' or wanderer. This also made him initially sexist towards women, a trait that was removed for the anime.

9.name: LN Canon: Claudia Hodgins
9.content: In the Light Novels, Claudia Hodgins' personality before founding the CHPC was more roguish. He was known for being flirtatious and was implied to have had a string of one-night stands (with both men and women) before settling into his paternal role for Violet and running the company.

10.name: Other Nations: Neutral States
10.content: In addition to the warring powers, the Telsis continent also has neutral nations that were not directly involved in the Great War, though their neutrality was sometimes violated. Two such nations are Intense and Bocciacia.
